reviews.review:
"What do you feel like eating?" is probably the most difficult decision my bf and I ask each other all the time. Sometimes it takes us forever to come up with a decision, other times it doesn't. But thanks to Yelp, we found this place and both agreed on it right away. 

Right away, our drinks arrived along with our chips and dip. Dip was beans, tomatillo sauce and a chipotle roasted salsa. All delish and packed with flavor. I don't usually like beans, but these were pretty good. The bf also put in an order of guacamole with crab. Their guacamole was also really good. It was thick and chunky with big pieces of crab on top. 

Now for our main dishes. Since I was getting full from chips and dip, I opted for a cup of chicken tortilla soup and a side salad. My cup of soup was a huge serving for it being in a cup. It was ok, nothing special. It was a little on the salty side so I wasn't able to eat it all. I also got a side salad, which was AWFUL!! When it arrived at the table, there was so much cheese on it. Then I noticed the reason why it was covered in so much cheese was because the lettuce was old and wilted. I asked our server to just take it off the bill and she was shocked that my salad looked the way it did. She was nice about it and took it off. The bf's carne asada burrito was the highlight of the meal. The meat was so tender. Although the burrito was on the smaller side, it was packed with so much meat, cheese and beans that we both got full from it. 

Definitely a good spot for Tex-Mex food! Since I live so far away, I doubt I'll be eating here any time again soon. If I'm in the area, this will definitely be a one of my options though.

This is the real deal, imagine authentic Mexican food at an affordable price in a clean and welcoming environment.  I first noticed this place in a food show where this restaurant competed against some top notch restaurants on the Strip and they won!

A bit of warning, this is not Tex Mex, so the flavors are more on the milder side. If you need to, they offer various hot sauces.

I ordered the soft tortilla soup and it was great with the subtle tomato flavor with a squeezed lime is a good balance to bean and starchy flavor.

You can also appreciate the care they put into their chicken enchiladas, it's baked perfectly without being overcooked, the shredded chicken is moist and seasoned perfectly.  It's a great deal for $11 and change.

If there is any drawback is the drive here from the Strip, it would take 30 - 35 minutes to get here.  But that won't detract from the great food.

Awesome!!! Loved our night there. We met up with Leticia and some friends. The food was very good. The environment is nice. The tacos are award winning and worth the order. Also, get some Mexican coffee. It is very, very good. We were staying on the strip and vegas and this is worth the 20 minute trip out.
Some of the best street tacos I have had! Great salsas and my little girl loves the cheese queso.

The food is good, the fajitas are a pass, bland.  My wife and daughter's  dinners were fine.  my problem is the service, we ordered an appetizer and received it with the dinner and I ordered a salad that never showed up.  4 different people were at our table at one time or another and nobody could get it right. Every person thought the other was getting what we ordered,  frustrating. The bill came promptly and he remarked that he took the salad off the bill, like he was going me a favor.
Loved the salsa and chips. Shredded beef enchilada preferred over the chicken one. I followed a yelp suggestion.
This places is amazing I love the food and always good and friendly service. One of my favourite restaurant in town

This place was recommended by one of my neighbors.  We should have gotten a hint as they mostly talked about the drinks... not the food.

Went there with a party of 4.  It was a Wednesday night so it was not busy by our food took a while.  Ordered a stake.  It was ok, but nothing great.  I would not order it again.  My husband got a carne asada burrito.   Much better than my stake.  My daughter got a soup, which was ok as well.

Overall the place is good and the food is ok.  Give it a try!

Authentic Mexican right down the street! Nice ambiance. Food was outstanding! I had chicken fajitas and they were excellent. My wife had a combination plate which is not on the menu but they were happy to create for her. The margaritas were tasty and beer was cold. I can see why some would think service was slow but it worked out well for us since we were with friends and it was nice not to be bothered by the waiter. But we never had to ask for a refill and they did a great job cleaning the table around us without being annoying. We will definitely make this place a frequent stop!
We used to go to Leticia's all the time but the food quality has gone way down hill.  We won't be going back.
Great place for dinner...  Nice setting and friendly staff!  The food came within five minutes of ordering and it was phenomonal!

I feel very lucky they opened this place near me. Not only is it cozy, but the food is very good. Love the taquiza cart they have out on Monday nites during the the summer. I hear they will be offer the taquiza cart for the "Movie In The Park" events this summer. They have good Sunday brunch deals and happy hour.  I believe they also have karaoke on Saturday nites.
Excellent meal. My husband enjoyed the tostadas and I had a cheese enchilada and a chicken enchilada. We will return.

We snuck in to this place back when it opened, and are good for once a month trip. Without fail, one of us ALWAYS gets the El Molcajete, not a better dish in Las Vegas. 
Ever thankful it survived to now THRIVE in this economy!
So yummy! Great staff and awesome authentic mexican food! It's off the strip and well worth the drive.

Dislikes: greasy food. i mean, GREASY. running fat all over the place. is it how mexican food is usually like? you tell me. but i am not a fan of the food.  

Likes: refills for lattes!! NICE.

The good here is great! Very authentic and fresh. Their lunch specials are great and you can't beat the price either. This last time I had the carnitas and tortilla soup and both were AMAZING! This if definitely one of my favorite places. Only con is the server was pretty slow and it took forever to get a refill on our drinks.

Spent Cinco de Mayo there,  their margarita was very good, very authentic. 
The food, delightful,  very good for Mexican food,  ordered carne asada (a little overpriced,  $16.99),  margaritas (it gets better by the glass) and their street tacos (I had carne asada and carnitas)was very good, very well seasoned. 
If you are a margarita connoisseur, try one, you'll thank me later (if you remember).
I recommend this place to anyone who enjoys traditional Mexican food,  with an authentic flavor.
Oh,  did I mentioned their margaritas?

So glad we found a mexican restaurant on this side of town!  Was pleasantly surprised...cute shopping center and decor. The place was busy for lunch on Saturday with no waiting time.  The chips and salsa/bean dip were good.... The husband got the Street Tacos (chicken and carnitas) which was excellent served along side beans and rice.  I got the Mexican style Hamburguesa (because we just had mexican the night before!) and this was like a torta, but so tasty!  Not like a regular hamburger and big enough to share!  They have a  great happy hour M-F which I can't wait to try when I'm not pregnant and can enjoy some margaritas!  :)  Can't wait to go back. Fun atmosphere and would love to sit outside next time.

My mom is from Michoacan and Leticia's Cocina is like going home with a culinary twist. It's a testament to how authentic the flavors of each dish is when my own mom makes me take her here when she visits. I usually eat at the bar because the bartenders are charming and attentive. I have tried everything on the menu and never  been disappointed.

We were able to eat outdoors and it was perfect, with the patio trees and the lights above.  The staff was very friendly and the food was super yummy. It was a wonderful evening and all of us in our group said we would be back.

I've been going to this Restaurant every Saturday for months! It became almost like a family tradition! The main reason my group  went is because of the superb service we would get from JUSTIN! We were at a loss for words to hear that he was no longer there! Justin is such an asset and will truly be missed by many!! What a loss!!!

Went here because I heard a lot of rave reviews from coworkers etc, and honestly, I am not impressed. It could be that my expectation is too high, but the service sucks. The waitress forget about getting tortillas, doesn't even know her own menu and idk she's was just not paying attention at all, which I would understand if it was busy, but it wasn't that night and there was just another table and a couple of ppl @ the bar. The food that I have ordered was wayyy too salty and it just didn't taste good. My fiancé ordered a burrito and he said it was alright. They never check on us till the end when we asked for the check and by then they send a manager? To see if we want them to remake the food. But seriously, i just wanna get out of there by then. There's no point of remaking the food when my fiancé is done eating and well just end up staying there for probably another hour longer. Just waiting. 
Crappy service, meh food, and it's not even cheap. We will not be back.
Oh and they were on dirty dining and attempted to hide their grade smh.

The service was terrible! We came in on Mother's Day. We arrived at 2:45 and was told it would be a 30 minute wait. No problem, they took my phone number so they could text when the table was ready. We were four with a high chair. I specifically mentioned we'd need a high chair. Around 30 minutes later I received the text our table was ready. This is when it all started to go wrong. The hostess was ready to seat us and then says 'oh you need a high chair'. Apparently the table we were supposed to get would not accomodate a high chair or it would have been in the way. So they would get us another table.  15 minutes later we're still waiting. I took my son to the bathroom and noticed a large party had just left and the staff was pulling apart the 3 tables they had used. I figured that one of those would be for us; the space looked perfect to fit the high chair. But no, they took two of the tables and put them together with some others to seat another large party that had arrived after us! After another 10 minutes they  finally seated us at a two top booth that they added a two top table to. It was squished and awkward. Sitting there for almost 10 minutes we still had not been greeted, had no chips and salsa and no drinks. Finally a busboy brought the chips etc and asked if we wanted something to drink. I tried to order a margarita but he said her could only bring water.    Our server finally showed up asking if we'd been helped yet. He said since no one had helped us he would. He also said it was shift change time, trying to explain, we assumed, about the wait time. However since it was now 4:15 and the place closes at 9 we figured that was bs. We gave him our food and drink order right away.  The drinks were brought out then another 15, 20, 25 minutes goes by with nada. My husband had to go to work soon and we had no idea the experience would be so time consuming. We were literally rising from our seats to leave when the food showed up. The food was good but not spectacular. Between the high prices and the piss poor service we were hoping for something better food wise. At one point my husband talked to the manager about the situation. She was flustered and nervous and simply did not know how to handle the complaint. Over all her attitude was 'oh well', (shrug). No offers to comp anything, not my kid's meal or even my margarita. No attempt whatsoever was made to assuage the situation. After we finished eating we sat and waited some more and then had to ask for our check. We chose to go there because of the good reviews and high stars. But after a closer review I've noticed many other reviewers have had similar complaints. Needless to say, we will not return, we will not recommend, and we will let others know not to bother with this restaurant.

This place is excellent! We had friends visiting from out of town and we decided to try out Leticia's, as we were all craving Mexican food. This place did not disappoint. There were nine of us. Despite the fact that they were very busy, we were able to be seated after only a short wait. The staff was terrific. They were friendly and attentive. Not only did our server make sure our needs were met but two other gentelmen came over to make sure everything was to our liking. I spilled my iced tea and someone was at my side as soon as it happened, helping to wipe up the mess. She was really nice about it and within 60 seconds, it was cleaned up and I had a fresh glass of tea. It was as if it had never happened. We were there on their karaoke night and that was a lot of fun. We've decided that we'll always try to go there on karaoke night. Most importantly, the food was delicious. The portions were just right and everything tasted perfect. I'm really excited that we finally tried this place. We're from out of state and there is a Mexican restaurant back home that I miss all the time. This place totally helps fill that void.

My husband and I had one of our first dates here....and we just about LOVED everything about this place. The location, the service, the quality, the ambiance - everything!

The service was amazing. I am not a big margarita person but I had quite a few that night and I didn't get heartburn. Plus the street tacos I had were so delicious!

I had their beef tamales and they were AWESOME and the most authentic I've had in Vegas.

Unfortunately, we now live on the other side of town but we always are looking for an excuse to go back.
Expensive for the food they make. I mean its okay but they do charge for a refill on horchata!

I love locally owned restaurants with a casual comfort feel... I enjoyed outdoor dining out in the patio and it's nicely lit. The food from this place is incredible. We went here for our anniversary and our server made our night so memorable and he was very detailed on the food and gave us plenty of choices since it's our first time. Try this place out!

One of my favie mexican spots! This place is fun and funky with great food! My girlfriends and I went in for a few drinks, and dinner, and were pleasantly surprised with the high quality and delish food served. I appreciated that I was able to order a few different things on one plate, I believe it was an app item to mix and match apps, which made me so happy! The fire roasted corn with crema and some type of amazing crumbly mexican cheese was LEGIT! 

Note, they have lots of veggie options! #veggie4life

I  love Leticia's! Great Mexican joint just minutes from my house. Tasty chips and salsa, delicious margaritas, and nice bar area.   So many menu items to choose from. 

I still have to get there for the karaoke and weekend brunch, but really looking forward to it!

This is my first time giving 5 stars.  Our friends chose this based on a food network program they had seen. I don't usually like Mexican food AT ALL!  This place is terrific.  Luciano was our waiter and he was a wonderful as all the food we tried.

This review was strictly on take out.  We ordered chicken Enchiladas, beef Enchiladas, fish tacos, Carne Asada tacos, beans, rice, and chiveche. 

They really packed the take put order perfectly with pans and lids and utensils. Food was perfectly heated when we ate it.  Ill be honest I'm not the most professional Mexican food critic because we have limited selection in Hawaii but truthfully the food was solid and very tasty.  The portions were generous and very filling.  Great place to get take out from for larger parties. 

Only thing I wish was better is that for the amount of food we ordered they should have provided more chips and salsa. They only gave us a small sampling of their salsa I felt they should have been more generous with that.  Other than that the good was solid.

Food never disappoints, and service is typically top-notch. The place can get crowed quick, but for good reason. 
If you sit outside, the audio from the TVs plays on the system, so it's a bit distracting. 
Definitely one of the best options for Mexican in the area!

I'll keep it simple and short for the Bottom Line: you want good DF Mexican food? This is the place.

Had the Mexican grilled corn and the house queso tacos. Grilled corn was okay. Tacos are amazing..!

My favorite Mexican restaurant in all of LV. Happens to be close to gown too! Have eaten multiple dinners and loved them all. Recently I was able to attend a business meeting and was exposed to a breakfast menu that was delish! Wait staff has always been superb and recommends new dishes and combos. Lots of times I let them choose my meal.

It has been a while since we ventured this way and we forgot how good the food really is.  The menu is excellent, the smells coming from he kitchen are rich and mouth watering.  They are very busy tonight but we manage to get a seat.  

We order a couple of appetizers, Mexican Shrimp Cocktail, large chunks of crab, shrimp, lime, avocado, and tostaditas, very good, and the Volcanoes tostaditas, 3 mini tostades with yummy melted cheese, pico de gallo and creme.  Both very good.

For my main entree, I couldn't resist getting the El Molcajete (fajitas), grilled carne asada, tiger prawns,  grilled nopales (cactus) and again some yummy melted cheese served in the volcano bowl.  Love this, a must try.

Service was great, food was delicious, just wish she'd open a location on the West side!

Amazing food! We live in Henderson and routinely drive out there. Get the quesa tacos with or the El molcajete. I promise you won't be disappointed with either of them. Get a side of the rice casserole too.

I go out for lunch every Tuesday with my mother in law and we usually eat Mexican food because no one in her house will eat it and its her favorite. Lately its been disappointing between poor customer service, messed up orders and flavorless meals so we were THRILLED after deciding to try Leticia's.  The service was great, the food came out quickly and everything tasted fantastic!

This will be our new regular spot. Try the shrimp ceviche. It's the best I've had in Las Vegas.

Amazing food. The only thing better than the food was the service. Worth the drive from the strip for sure. The seafood enchiladas, best I've ever had! Four of us went, we all took leftovers home, and everyone left full and very happy.

I love the el pastor burrito they make its awesome. the  pitcher margaritas are not fresh made meaning its a margarita mix. the bar is quiet and the bartenders are pretty cool. i come here often i like the happy hour options AS WELL. they keep the place clean and the bathrooms are kept up as well
Always love it here. Best margaritas and Mexican food in town, hands down!! Don't miss out. The enchiladas are my favorite, any style!

We had been to Lateesha's on several different occasions and had mixed reviews. The food was pretty good and decent enough for Mexican. We went up one afternoon and left quickly after finding a large bug on the ground by the waiting area. We have not been back since.
Place has gone downhill since my first review. We have been back several times and it's always hit or miss. It really depends on what server you get but even when basically empty the service is slow.

This place is right by my mom's house so we go regularly. Go for lunch if you don't want to wait for a table.the staff is always really nice. Never a long wait for the food to arrive. This place is just good cheap Mexican food! The pork tamales are a must! The sopapillas are a great desert! I love the street Tacos..everything I try here is awesome! The yummy salsa and bean dip are complimentary with any order of food:)

With the economy how it is, it's great to see a family business thriving. The house is always packed but I still receive great service. The owners are always there talking to customers and even serving the food! The food is fantastic and reasonably priced which is always great paired with their signature margaritas!

I know everyone loves this place but our group of 6 left deciding never again. Good came we had no silverware. Ask 3 employees and 4 minutes later someone brought it to us. Yea, we timed it. So we sat there looking at our food. No one refilled our water so finally my husband went to the busser station and brought back a pitcher of water and filled our drinks. Our food was way too salty. Our friend ordered an appetizer that never came too. Like I said never again. For the price we got bad food and no service. This place is over rated.

Last night I visited for the second time.  The first time, I say the service was horrible and so was the food, but didn't want to give it a bad review off one visit.  Well last night made up for the my first visit.  

I came in with a friend and we sat at the bar.  There was only 2 other people up there and the bartender acknowledge us right away and said he would be right with us.  Drinks were served fast and once we figured out want we wanted to eat, our order was taken promptly.  While we were sitting waiting, the bartender was nice and chatting with us.  Definitely makes sitting at the bar a plus.  My friend said he would come back just to sit at the bar and hang out with him.

The food, I ordered carne asada tacos with rice and beans.  The carne asada was so yummy with great flavor.  It only had onions and cilantro on top and that was really all I needed.  My friend had a chicken burrito, enchilada style and after one bite he was all about it.  He cleaned is plate!

I will definitely come back now that I have had better experience!

Friends recommended this eatery. We got there before the dinner rush and got our name on the list with a wait time of 15 minutes. As we were waiting (only two of us) they kept taking parties of two, three and more and left us waiting. After almost 30 minutes and other folks who came in after us, we left and went to Que Mas. Will not be going back.

My first-time experience on Valentine's Day was horrible! Both my boyfriend's and my plate came out all wrong, and the waitress had the audacity to argue with us about it. By the time my meal came back (still wrong), it was awful. I ordered the grilled fish tacos, and I couldn't even tell there was fish in it until I picked through it with my fork. The fish appeared to be grounded or mashed...disgusting! The bottom line is that they served the worst Mexican food I'd ever had.

One of the hidden gems on the North side of Las Vegas. It's located near a cute area that looks like it's near a mini townsquare :) The food is awesome and the dips for the tortilla chips are amazing. The service was good but it took awhile for our water to be refilled and it took a while for our hot sauce to come to our table. We were already almost done with our meals by the time our server came to give us hot sauce. Other than that, we had a good experience.

Pleasantly surprised. This was a really nice dinner!
This side of town doesn't have a lot of four and five star places to eat.
Complimentary Chips, Beans, and Salsa were tasty and arrived very quickly upon being seated.
Cadillac Margarita was super yummy.
My hubby had the Queso Shrimo Tacos which he loved!
I had the Flautas. One Carnitas, One Potato and Cheese, One Carne Asada. All were delicious!
Rice and Beans came with each entree and were surprisingly above average.
I will definitely return!

We took my father-in-law there and he ordered a steak burrito. He asked them if there was any shrimp in it because he is allergic to shrimp. He was told no. When the food came (after about an hour wait), he took a few bites and realized there was shrimp in it. Luckily, he had some benadryl with him and took it immediately. We told the waitress and she apologized. No manager came to talk to us. No owner came to talk to us. If he hadn't had the benadryl with him, he would have ended up at the hospital. Not good.

Just found this place a couple months ago and it is becoming a regular for us.  Great food, area of town and service.  I can only say that the taco salad is delicious because that's all I get.  The food my family orders looks as good as mine.  Sometimes there is a little bit of a wait which only testifies to the great meal they serve.  Tonight though, no wait at all.  Just an all around nice restaurant with great food at a reasonable price.
Very busy tonight. Food was right on point. Try the puffy chicken tinga tocos. They are marvelous.

Fun atmosphere,  large portions and delicious salsa choices.  The habanero salsa is only for the brave (and those who freeze their TP).  

This has quickly become our favorite Mexican restaurant since moving to Las Vegas.  You typically end of taking much of your food home because of both the portion size and the attentive nature of their servers who keep the chips and salsa coming. 

Plan ahead Saturdays as every time we have gone there is a 30 minute wait.

They have family style which we are yet to try but it looks like a really good option as well.

FINALLY!!!! A Mexican  place with veggie options!!! I got the sautéed veggie tacos. They were amazing!!! Cool atmosphere, cute place! My husband got a burrito, it was huge!! Definitely my new favorite Mexican place in town!!!!

We went in on Thursday night this was our 2nd time there and just like the 1st time it was incredible worth the 20 min drive off the strip we had the best Chili Rellenos I've ever had and the EL Mojecte was incredible we will make it a point to go there every time we go to Las Vegas wait staff was also great

I rarely give out 5 stars but this Mexican restaurant is worth every star!

The service and food is both 5 stars. 

Right when we sat down, we got chips and salsa right away. Also the manager came around and greeted us. But he kinda scared me when he said hi because he pop his head around the wall lol!

The salsa was bomb!!!!!!!!! We got the green  salsa and some kind if brown one. The brown salsa was so good! Wish the green salsa wasn't that salty but it would of been really good! We also got beans as out dip too! I mixed the green salsa and bean together so it won't be so salty so that was good.

It took me forever to order cuz I didn't know what to get! Everything sounded so good! 

I got the make your own burrito! I got confused of the meat part cuz it i wanted shredded beef so the menu said "shredded chicken or beef & carnitas" so I thought they give you both beef and carnitas cuz it didn't say OR . Right? You pick one meat and its a dollar extra if you want another one. So I got charged . Idk what sauce to get for my burrito so I got something red lol and cheese! It was good too! Haha but damn was that burrito huge ;)  haha! 


My hubby got 2 tacos they were able to let him choose 2 different meat with no extra charge! Shredded beef and shrimp!

Out waitress also got us a super super spicy salsa! Habanero!! Omg was that spicy!!!!!! I'm on fire!!!! Hahaha! 

Soo full after a third of my burrito! Well..Probably cuz all that yummy chips and salsa! 

Last but not least! I almost forgot my churro that I saw on yelp that someone posted a picture! And that looked bomb! And guess what! It's so darn fresh!!!! So when our waitress brought it out, I noticed I didn't get any sauce like raspberry and Carmel. She said its order on ask so I was aww oka but then  she still got it for me!! :) yaya! Couldn't eat the churro there :( but it had to be eaten that night ! And it was warm still when I got home! It was still so good! Drooool have to come here again!!! :)))))))

Best Mexican food around the valley. Been here several times for lunch and dinner and have never been disappointed. The staff is great and the food is fantastic. The chips are fresh and they bring you 3 different dips, bean dip, avocado dip and a salsa. All of which are great. The fajitas are the best I have ever had. They also have several award winning dish that when you try them you will know why. Margaritas are perfect too. Must try this place. You won't go wrong.

Beautiful building inside and out.  Nice relaxing atmosphere inside.  Service was good and quick.  They serve chips and salsa while you wait for your meal.  They were delicious.  They give you three different homemade salsas.  I loved the green one.  I ordered the carne asada tacos.  The carne came in a bowl filled with sauce. Only thing I didn't like about it.  It was like a stew and hard to pull the meat out to put on the tortilla.  Tortillas were fresh and prices are reasonable. Overall it was a good experience, had a great time  and I'll be back.

Been here 15/20 times the food is great. Get here early this place sometime has a 1or 2 hour  wait due to the food being do good. The owner is running around here all the time making sure everything is perfect. The servers and bartenders are strip quality.

Chef Leticia has created a little slice of Mexico here in Las Vegas.  Some of my Favorites are Cochinita Pibil absoutely superb, Elote Mexican Grilled Corn, Fresh Salsas & Chips, Mini Empanaditas.  They also offer Family Style meals great for everyone.  Really lovely Margaritas and you can dine outside when weather permits.  Great location right off freeway and well priced with sizable portions.  Tell Chef Leticia that Chef Sandra sent you!

Dreary experience. Came in before 8pm, had to wait 15 minutes for a table in a near-empty restaurant. We ordered, and waited 45 minutes; we were finally served, with a few dishes ignored and the rest cold. 5 minutes later, bright spotilights came up so that they could start cleaning up.  We asked the speak to the manager, who had the lights lowered slightly. She also comped one drink on a $130+ bill.  Particularly unappetizing was the $29 Molcajete De Mariscos, which was a shallow bowl of gummy overcooked riced with a thin covering of fish and a few shrimps.

I give 3 of the stars to the waiters since they do a fantastic job.
The food is FORSURE overrated compared to the yelp reviews (I'm always weary when a non-minority person comments on how good a minority food restaurant is lol).
I had the Quesa shrimp tacos and they were just really cheesy with no flavor.
Did I tell you that at least the waiters were on point?

You Vegas Yelpers failed me again as usual..

Tip: Go visit South Gate, LBC, Lynnwood, any hood SoCal area for better food than this.

My husband was so excited to take me here. I really do feel bad for him...although we checked the reviews before we came to verify that it would be a good experience. After sitting for an hour and not receiving our food I can not in good conscience rate this establishment more than 1 star.

Food is delicious. However, the owner can invest some quality time in teaching her employees some good restaurant etiquette. Hostess skips waiting customers on the list to give first available tables to the neighborhood favs!

What happened to this place? It used to be amazing now the service is bad and the food is so dry I am so disappointed they didn't even give a salt and pepper on the table because our food needed it what happened to the old managers? We went there to sit outside and they said it was closed? We only gets so much good weather here in Vegas and you r telling me no seating outside. And our meal was expensive for what we got.

I have been here a couple times and could say the food is good every time. The serving size is definitely a lot for one person! My family always enjoys coming here for the food. Now the service is what makes it three stars. The service is not so great. Last time we had about 3 different waiters and we didn't get checked on at all. Then we had got our food with out any silverware and waited about 10 minutes to get them. This is the only negative thing about this place. However, the food is always great and is the reason why I will come back!
Wife and I LOVE the place! We just had another great meal and we will keep coming back. Everything is fresh and not from a can. What a novel idea! You owe it to yourself to go here.

This place surprised me. When we got there (about 7:30) the place was PACKED! We were told 25 min to wait so we went to the bar; bartenders very friendly. I got a peach frozen margarita....YUMMY! And my man had a beer. We didn't wait more 15 min (it seemed). Our waitress was very friendly. The food came out super fast and was DELICIOUS!

Leticia's is by far the best restaurant in the area. I have tried several of the items on the menu but my favorite is the "Loaded" quesadilla. It has spinach, mushrooms and chicken. this quesadilla is AWESOME. It is listed under the appetizer section of the menu but it is big enough for an entree. The other item which i think is a must try is the strawberry margarita with a hint of jalepeno (I dont recall the name on the menu) YUM!

The food was good, the service was very attentive. Enjoyed the atmosphere and the bountiful servings. Staff is friendly and knowledgeable. Even the drinks were refreshing. All-in-all, I'd come here again and bring more people to enjoy their wonderful offerings!

Maybe I came on an off day? Maybe my expectations are a little too high as of late? But seriously, how does this place have this volume of ratings and maintain this high of an average?!
I'm not sure if I'm more pissed at the restaurant for being sub-par or this many yelpers being fooled by such simple bullshit. It's my fault for being on my dying cell phone and not taking the time to read the reviews. Otherwise I would have dismissed this place IMMEDIATELY when I realized  "multiple salsas" was the CONSISTENT 5 star standard for a quality establishment!  Are you frickin kidding me?

Food.  I'll try to take my shitty experience out of this equation for the moment and ask why people love this bland cookie cutter On the Boarder franchise-esq, no heart, soulless food? After finally be able to put in the order (after 20 min wait) we waited another 20 mins (I know because I timed it) to get a cold to semi-warm plate, the carnitas was over cooked, tough (that's a HUGE accomplishment if you know how to make it) and bland. Had a nice piece of bone in there too. The beans had that nice dried crust layer on top like it had been sitting under the heat lamp a little too long but was too far to get the heat. 
That salsa everyone loses their shit over, was okay. El Torrito and On the Boarder has that too, so does Rubio's technically. 

Service: This was just stupid. And I'm kicking myself for not walking out. Went on a late Sunday afternoon after hiking Mt. Charleston (needless to say, hungry). The place is hardly busy. One girl comes over to take drink orders, says she can't take beer orders, but the the bartender can who will also be our waitress. I don't know why she couldn't have given our order to the bartender when she informed her of our table. 10 mins later, bartender comes (Natalie) "You want something from the bar?" Place DRINK order. I've been watching her from my table 15 ft away flirting with some douche face at the bar. Beer comes out in a glass so cold the beer is slushy. I'm not only a pretentious dick, I'm also a beer snob. I like to taste my beer, frozen glass = no taste. In spite of my annoyance, I asked nicely If I can have a glass that isn't iced. Natalie "They all come like that."  Me, "how about that (soda) glass that isn't frozen or run one under some cold water?" 10 mins pass, flirts with douche, comes back, replaces beer in different frozen glass. Now takes FOOD order.
Food comes out like it's been under a heat lamp and the beans have that nice crust on them. We pick at our food. Flag  Natalie down for our bill, and get the hell out of this pit.

This place sucks. The food sucks, the service sucks, the menu sucks. there isn't any thing redeeming about this place. Someone please correct me if I'm out of line here.

My fiance and I decided to check this place out via a referral from a friend. We waited about 20 to 30 minutes to be seated which was fine as they were busy at the time. After we sat down though our waitress was nice she was really slow at attending to our table. Once our food finally came to our table it looked as though it had been sitting for awhile. You know when you put fresh beans on the plate they have a moistness to them.. These looked like dried old beans along with this on my fiance's plate he also received a taco where literally the shell wasn't cooked, it's as though they took it out of the package onto the plate no heating at all, the waitress didn't believe him so he had her physically touch the shell which was raw and she agreed and seemed taken back by it. The main course of his dish was cold on the inside which brought him to believe it was frozen then just reheated. As for my plate im vegetarian and found something suitable enough for me the volcanes, I asked the waitress to leave the cheese off to the side as I'm more vegan than vegetarian. After waiting for about an hour to get our food a different waitress finally brought our plates and there on my meal the cheese was on top. Since we'd been waiting so long I was like screw it I'll just eat it. Though I found out the guacamole and the pico have jalapenos in it which im allergic to unfortunately so I sent the plate back and since they aren't really a vegan friendly restaurant I settled for the Spanish rice which tasted like it came from a box. For all the hype this restaurant puts out it was extremely over priced for what you get and the service is horrible. I wouldnt recommend this place. The only reason I gave two stars was because the ambiance of the physical restaurant itself was nice.

So good. So, damn good.

This is, by far, my favorite off-strip restaurant in Vegas. I've had about 2/3 of the menu and everything was perfect. Never a bad dish. Ever.

The Costillitas are so good, you'll want to kiss the chef.  Seriously. Dude. Just, dude. So good.

If you get enchildas, ask for the Tinga with white sauce and thank me later.

The chips and salsa are all handmade and excellent and irresistible.

It makes me sad to think it is not longer just down the street, since our move to Spokane.

I was hopeful that this would be our spot for Mexican food but........the restaurant was clean and cute but very loud, even at 4:30 on a Sunday as they are busy.  The food was bland, sorry to say.  Nothing jumped out as being flavorful and quite honestly, for the price, we've had better food elsewhere.  The portions are a good size, so that is a plus and service was good.  The red sauce on the enchiladas was really potent as I would not recommend it at all.  I would say give this a try, but as this was a hike for us to get to, I would rather go the opposite direction to Mi Casa where the beef enchiladas with red sauce are delicious!  Sorry, I wanted to really like this place but not worth the drive for us.

We have been going to Leticia's since they first opened....everything is homemade, fresh and DELICIOUS! The staff is very friendly and you can tell they really enjoy themselves! The entire menu is great! Enjoy....

2.5 Stars

I wanted to like it. I really wanted to since the reviews were very recommending. 

1 - We came on a Sunday Afternoon about 2pm or so. We waiting for about 15-20 minutes before getting seated only to find plenty of sitting was there the whole time. Why leave your guest waiting when they don't have to?
NEGATIVE

2 - The CHIPS were delicious! Not overly done, just perfect as it crumbled very nice. 
POSITIVE

3 - Our server compeltely forgot our GUACAMOLE. 
NEGATIVE

4 - The no spice sauce was SALTY. Even for me that loves salt!
NEGATIVE

5 - Horchata is one of the best Horchata's I've ever had. Delicious. 
POSITIVE POSITIVE

6 - The wait time for food was ridiculous. About 30 minutes for, Chimichanga Style Burrito (nothing fancy) & a plate of Cheese Enchilada & a taco (Carne Asade was dry). 
NEGATIVE NEGATIVE

7 - The staff was OK - nothing out of ordinary

8 - Decor was nice.

-2

Overall, we were thoroughly disappointed after our $30 bill. Wouldn't drive out of the way for this FAVORITE Mexican of most :(

My partner saw the head chef on a local #LasVegas tv show and wanted to try it.

Since then we have been twice. Great meal both times!
I have had the shrimp diablo, bacon wrapped shrimp tossed in a spicy tomato sauce. YUM! Bacon and shrimp...come on people. Magic. Homemade guac! Delish! Pozole - Hell yessss! The only thing I have had here that I have not loved was the shrimp ceviche. Kinda meh. Everything else! perfect!

Great, authentic Mexican food. Large portions. Outstanding service.
Went there for the first time 2 days ago, and I'm already looking forward to my next visit.

This place has been on my radar for awhile. And sad to say but was disappointed. Atmosphere is amazing but everything in between fell through; menus with food still on it, slow service. It almost seemed as there was 1 server for the whole restaurant. I was craving the Mexican corn. Now I've had this before, not here, but I was familiar with the taste. The corn arrived and looked amazing however the corn tasted as if it was sitting in a pot of boiling water. It was soggy and very watery. 
The entrees were okay. I didn't order it but had a bite of the grilled shrimp cheese taco which is a must! Unfortunately I'm one of the few that will say I probably won't be returning. Not my favorite for Mexican food.

Went on a whim last night and it was fabulous! Mario was our server and he was phenomenal. Fajitas, mole, and carne asada were our choices and all delish. We started with the Mexican corn and their homemade chips and salsas. 

I have not one negative thing to say. It was so so good! Our whole experience was perfect.

Great local Mexican restaurant with very authentic flavors.  Service is friendly, helpful and knowledgeable of the menu. The shopping complex they're located in is super cool also. Will definitely be back!

Food was fine but was asked to leave table after we paid our bill. It had only been a few minutes. We had not been drinking so it was not because we were drunk, maybe it was because we were not drinking and spending enough $. Either way- first time and last time.

Very disappointed with the service. I rarely go out to eat Mexican food but today I was craving Menudo. We were seated right away at a booth right by the bar. The waitress asked what we wanted to drink since we didn't know she brought us water. Upon her return with the waters we told her we wanted a cafe de la olla and a café con leche. I was in the middle of asking her what the different bowl sizes were when she interrupted me to tell me she would be right back because she wanted to put in our coffee order because it would take about 10 min to make. She left and it took her a while to come back. She came back because I flagged her down because I wanted to give her our food order. My sister and I ordered enchiladas and a small menudo. We waited a while and she finally brought our food out. She asked how everything looked and I said it was ok but we still needed our coffee. She left to check on them and after a few minutes she came back and told us that she had forgotten to put our order in and that they would take a while more to come out. Our coffee finally came out by the time we were almost done eating the menudo tasted old by the way. We sat at our booth finished our coffee and the waitress never came back. Finally after a long wait I flagged her down and asked for our check. That took a long time to get when she finally brought it to me I handed her my credit card without looking at the check. This woman walked all over the place with my check and card and I had to wait a very long time just to pay. I finally got up and walked over to her and told her I needed to leave and that she needed to run my card and give me by receipt and card back. I have been here before and I have never seen a waitress that is this disorganized she is too busy yapping and sticking her nose in other customers conversations. She did not charge us for our coffee but I would have rather she put in the order when she said she would that way we could have had our drinks with our meals. The restaurant was not busy when we got there and our order was easy. I just don't know why this waitress can focus.

Pozole was great! Food is fresh and really good! I had fajitas and hubby had pozole. Both excellent. With that being said, they do nickel and dime you here. This restaurant charges for everything! What really irritated me is they never mention the extra charges until you see the bill! The pozole came with one tiny quarter slice of lime. We asked for extra lime, and was charged. Tortillas are not included with pozole, and you will be charged for them. No refills on horchata either. Also kids meal includes a desert, but if you don't ask for it, they won't offer it.

Loved it here! Went for dinner last night with my boyfriend, got 2 frozen margarita's, the service was seriously fantastic! Everyone was really attentive with refilling our water cups and chip basket. Our server was amazing- super friendly, energetic, and checked on is often. Our drinks and food were ready quickly. Everything was delicious!! Definitely coming back soon!
Service was a little slow, but the food made up for it! Food was definitely 5 star, and the house margaritas were great too.

My family love  Leticia's! Whenever they come to visit this is on their list of "must go to" They usually request a 2nd & 3rd visit time allowing! The food is excellent, the staff are extremely friendly!

Looove this place. Usually there is a long wait but it's totally worth it. The food is amazing. Try the Cadillac margarita. Prices are very reasonable. Love the service. We like to sit outside because its so nice

The ambiance is probably my favorite aspect of Leticia's. This place has been on my radar for awhile but I simply don't find myself in this area of town very often. It's located on a cool little street that I didn't know existed. It has a nice atmosphere and I bet it would be a neat place to take a stroll at night. 

The service was just average, even a bit slow at times. Nice enough but it took longer than expected for condiments and few other items to show up at our table after the food arrived. I had the empanada lunch special with grilled shrimp. At $9 it was a reasonable portion, served with rice and beans. It was crazy heavy on the onions. I like onion for sure, but I couldn't taste anything else. The onion overwhelmed all the other flavors in the dish. Rice and beans were pretty standard, nothing to brag about. 

I also tried the shrimp a la diabla. It was much better than my own meal. Nice and spicy with a good amount of tiger prawns. I didn't try a margarita, perhaps it's the star of the show? With all the good reviews and the cool atmosphere I'll come back next time I'm in the area. I'd like to try the happy hour or dinner and have a few other menu items. This spot seems to have lots of potential. I just won't do the empanada on my next go.

I have always enjoyed coming to Leticia's for dinner, so I wanted to go there for happy hour.  I was greeted by Tammy the day bartender and she told me about the specials...I would have to say some of the best food and drink offerings for your money in Vegas.  Drafts 3.00 and quite a selection of delicious food items as well for only 3.00 each.  Tammy was great; she knows all her customers and I was treated just like a regular.  So if you need a cool place to hang out from 2 to 6, try Leticia's. You will not be disappointed!

Good food. I had the street tacos. They look small but they fill you up good. I asked for the hottest sauce they had and they waiter told me you have to ask for it cause they won't bring it out unless you ask. It lived up to how hot he told me it would be and he said it's made from scratch. Like this place gonna go back soon.
The food is awesome. Chili verde is delicious with lots of meat. The atmosphere is nice with the Latin music in the background and our server Tammy was super sweet!

Awesome food.  Everything we had was wonderful. The servers were nice and attentive although one was a bit clumsy a dropped stuff a few times but everyone has a bad day now and then. My friend had a pork chop with a green chile sauce on it.  It was so tasty that when I go back this is what I'm getting.

I live really close so I've eaten here a bunch out of convenience. I'm sorry to say that while some dishes that I've had ate good, the service is so slow that the experience is ruined.

Getting seated, ordering drinks, ordering a meal, getting a water refill, getting the check... Lunch will run 90 minutes or more for two. Going through two baskets of chips and still waiting another 15+ minutes for your food to come out is absurd and it happens on the regular.

Happy hour food is not good at all nor is the chocolate cake. Hh food is bland and cake has a bland & oily consistency. 

If it weren't for a few standout dishes, I'd give this place two stars, but I'm not likely to come back.

A few nights ago I found out that The Voice wanted to feature me on their fan spotlight. Of course, we had to go out and celebrate.

The feel and vibe is awesome. The perfect place to sip down a few margaritas and forget it's the weeknight. Oops!

The food was good. The chips and salsa are amazing. We both had tacos. In honesty, the margaritas were a little too amazing and the food is hard to remember. 

We'll be back for more food, and I'll update soon!

Though the service is very good, and owner, Gus, is a great guy, this place is a "Rich Man's" Taco Bell.

Food is very, very Gringo. That would explain why there is always a wait, and why you won't find one real Mexican eating there. 

Portions are large, but so is the price. It is way over priced for Mexican Food. 

Quality is just ok. 

I have a friend who is obsessed with the place, so I will go back if "he's buying".

I did take my neice and nephew, from Korea, who never ate Mexican Food. Gus was nice enough to spice up their food, and they did like the Carne Asada Soft Tacos.

So, if 'it's someone who's never eaten Mexican Food, sure. 

If you want quality and value for your dollar, go to an authenic Hole in the Wall.

We went on the recommendation of some friends and Im glad we did.  The food was delicious, large portions and at a great price.  Even on a Saturday night the service was friendly and fast.

I was a little worried when they told us they had karaoke going on, but we sat on the left side and it was no louder than some background music at many restaurants.

Really have nothing bad to say about the place.

Glad to find a more authentic Mexican restaurant in the north side of las vegas. I  love the bean dip that comes with the chips. My favorites here are the cochinita pibil and the pazole. Took 1 star away because service seems to be hit and miss for us so far, and I think it depends on which side of the restaurant you are sitting at.

The food is very good and the service is the best I've seen in a long time. I had the enchiladas and the tres leche cake. All very tasty. The server was VERY attentive and the asst manager stopped by to make sure we were happy. I will be back!

Last night my husband looked at me and said, "I want carne asada!"  Onto Yelp I go to find a good, authentic Mexican restaurant.  We just moved to the area and don't know our neighbors well enough to ask for any suggestions.  It has been hit or miss when it comes to the ratings on Yelp for more than one place since moving to LV.  I will say our visit to Leticia's was a HIT!

We took our two kids with us and had a little bit of a wait to be seated but it was no more than 10 minutes.  We sat in a booth right next to the kitchen so we could smell the food.  We were brought chips, beans and 2 salsas and asked for our drink orders.  My kids ordered sodas while my husband had a Blue Moon and I had a blended strawberry margarita.  We dug into the chips, beans and salsa.  I enjoyed the tomatillo salsa while my husband liked the red salsa and we both loved the beans.  The children ordered off the kids menu; my son had a bean and cheese burrito that came with beans and rice while my daughter ordered a hard ground beef taco which also came with beans and rice but she only wanted the rice.  My husband ordered the street taco platter which offered 3 street tacos with choice of carne asada, al pastor, carnitas or chicken.  He had 2 carnitas and 1 carne asada served with rice and beans.  I ordered the Ensenada taco platter which offered two tacos of your choice of fish or shrimp which I had one of each.

The food arrived fresh, hot and quick.  My husband devoured his taco platter leaving nothing behind.  I would say he enjoyed it!  My son ate all of his burrito and brought his beans and rice home.  My daughter only ate her rice and have of her taco because she was so full.  I only ate the fish taco and a small portion of my rice and beans.  We packed up our leftovers in their to go boxes, which are great and will reuse them!  All in all, our total bill was just under $60 for the 4 of us without the tip.

Pros:
1. Nice variety of offerings on the menu
2.  Chips, salsa and beans.
3. Portion size.

Cons:
1. When my daughter asked for no beans, I asked if they could give her double rice instead.  The kitchen didn't do that.  It wasn't worth sending back for more.
2. Parking- it's a little strange.  There is a parking lot behind/next to the restaurant but it seems odd.
3. The cons aren't deal breakers so we'll be back!

Its Saturday night 8:05 pm
There are 4 to 6 obviously very open tables at Leticia's
And they did it again tonight. With open tables everywhere, they said the same thing they always say, "sir, that'll be a 15 minute wait"
This has happened to us at least 6 times, but somehow we keep giving them a chance. Maybe its time to look around.
Folks, if you're interested in a wait for a restaurant that's not busy and blatantly treats the customers to waiting while you stare at lots of empty tables, then this is the place for you. If you're not interested in long waits for no reason, there are lots of other options close by; for example try the place next to Red Robin or if Italian would fit, go across the street to Streets of New York.
delicious, authentic mexican food. i had the chile colorado. amazing! and great customer service

Oh my!!!
Thee food and service is amazing.
I had burritos topped with the best mole and my fried the carnitas.
The mole not to sweet and carnitas tender.
When back in town definitely coming back.

We ate at Leticia's for the third and last time. We had a party of six with two children We ordered 3 soups, 2 flautas and one plate of street tacos so not an over abundance of food that should take a lot of time.  It took over 45 minutes for our food to arrive It was 2 in the afternoon and it seems like a normal afternoon crowd. The food was okay but when you wait that long with children it is unacceptable. My son in law ordered a side of jalapenos and onions and the waitress brought them out 10 minutes before his food..we didn't have to pay for them because he sent them back.  Tres leche cake was terrible ..only pineapple was used and canned at that. I recommend finding somewhere else to go..

The food was (again) delicious. I had the chile relleno carmelitas and a small bowl of pazole. Both were very flavorful and fresh tasting. 
Unfortunately this time the service was somewhat below average, which was hard to understand  considering that it was not busy at all for lunch.
Despite the weak service I will continue to go and work my way through the menu.

Leticia's is definitely my favorite local Mexican restaurant.  They usually prepare consistently good fresh food and the price is hard to beat.  Their carnitas, fish tacos, chile relleno, and buritos are some of the best you will find in the Las Vegas area.  Their chips and salsa are also decent.  The atmosphere is very nice and the decor has a warm and friendly feel.  Although I've occasionally had less than stellar service, it is usually very good.  If you're in the Northwest, chances are good Leticia's will be your choice when it comes to Mexican food.

Had amazing service from Kristanya and Vivian. Gustavo (co-owner/manager?) even stopped by the tables to check everyone's service and meal quality. 

After the chips, and great salsa's... I had the usual, carne asada burrito, and my daughter had a kids meal. We finished it off with a YELP fried ice cream, and sopapilla's. I really enjoy mexican food, and absolutely love great mexican food. The carne asada is awesome; I have to order it every time because it is seasoned and marinated so well.

I have had great food on every visit, and would definitely recommend that you eat here. The food prep times have been the only inconsistent part of the meal, but the excellent food and service makes up for the food prep issues. Hopefully they will work to make the prep times as consistent as the service and meal quality.

Great Mexican food, and always  great margaritas,
Good times with the festival's and party's they put on,
Gaming at the bar & close to home. This is a great spot for fun & great Mexican food!!

I've eaten here a handful of times with friends and with my husband. Every time I have ended up with a waiter that was not friendly or even seemed happy with his job. The last time I ate at this restaurant the waiter was just plain rude when I asked about something on the menu.  Other then the bad customer service the food is just ok.
Awesome service and great food! Just not quite a five star.
Great atmosphere! Amazing food, chips and salsa was bomb.com! Service was fast and friendly!!
The service sometimes is rocky because they are usually extremely busy but they always get the food out in a timely matter and it tastes great everytime!

This place is so good. The beans, and two salsas that come with the chips are AMAZING! I love this place ... but I always eat too much. And its crowded, pretty much all the times I go. The staff are super nice ... I've always had a good experience there, but ... it is ALWAYS crowded.
This place is pretty good.  Their tacos, burritos, chips, salsa, and fried ice cream is great.  I've been here 4 or 5 times and their pretty consistent with great service too!!!

Been here before- tonight we walked in & there was a wait. The hostess was so rude she greeted us visibly frustrated and said to us "30 minute wait are you staying?" It was the rude manner that she said this that made us leave. She obviously does not like her job and was taking her frustrations out on the customers. Never even looked up to make eye contact with us. **

Mgmt should hire nicer people that can better handle stressful situations.

If you're charging your meal to a credit card make sure you check your bank to ensure the right dollar amount was charged. The restaurant changed the amount of the tip I put on the receipt (the tip was written clearly) and I had to dispute it with my bank. Although it was not a huge amount it's troublesome thinking they would do that on purpose and I wonder how many customers they've done that to which was not caught. Tsk tsk shame on you Leticia Cocina!

I eat at Leticia's frequently.  I have tried many different dishes (all fantastic!) and have had many margaritas (delicious).  Great staff!  They have fun street festivals during special occasions.  So happy that it's close by!

I would give 0 stars if possible. What a ripoff. My sister and friends are regulars here and always talk about how amazing it is, so I was really looking forward to eating what I thought would be good Mexican food. We decided to order takeout on Sunday and were shocked at the poor quality of the food as well as ridiculous prices, which did not match the listed prices online. An order of 3 queso carne asada tacos, guacamole, french fries (for my nephew), and one lemonade ended up costing $68.  That would have been fine if the food was gourmet-level, authentic Mexican food but it tasted like Roberto's. If I wanted to eat subpar, greasy food I would have just gone there and paid their prices. One of our orders was supposed to sub a side salad for beans but the order included the beans with no salad in sight. The boxes had no markings to distinguish the spicy tacos from the mild. A few bites in, my cousin bit into a hair baked into her food so everybody was grossed out and that dish had to be thrown out. 

We also notified one of the staff that the prices aren't accurate on their online menu and he said that they already had 3 complaints about that earlier that day. Seems like they should either honor those prices or change their online menu so diners aren't in for a nasty surprise. The food was cold when we picked it up and they were very stingy with the condiments. When we asked for salsa, we were given a miniature to-go sauce container and told that if we wanted more it would be an additional $5. Don't order take-out from here unless you want to be nickel and dimed for every little thing.

The restaurant itself looks cute and has a nice atmosphere but the experience of ordering take-out was so frustrating and unpleasant that I will not be returning to dine in. I don't know if they had an off night or whether this is a common occurrence but that entire experience was completely unacceptable.

This is our favorite place to eat Mexican in Las Vegas! All of the food is freshly prepared. The menu has an extensive collection of traditional and house specialties. Happy hour is amazing. The queso fundido is my favorite appetizer. The capirotada is a favorite am dessert but only made seasonally! The shrimp quesa tacos are the most amazing and a family favorite of ours. Don't forget the sangria and / or margaritas!
Best Mexican in town. Salsas are to die for and their casserole rice is amazing!!!!

My fiancé is grotesquely addicted to Mexican cuisine. Wether it is authentic or TexMex, he craves it. If he could have a burrito everyday, he'd do so. I, on the other hand, find Mexican food on the same level as a Wendy's hamburger. Which is why I was delightfully surprised when we stumbled in here and found some great food, along with the warmest and most inviting decor I've encountered in North Las Vegas. Walking in was truly an eye-pleaser. We were immediately directed to a comfy booth, and then confronted with the traditional basket of complimentary chips and salsa. Two salsas, and a bean dip, all of which were tasty. 

The fiancé ordered the tamale plate, which was delicious, and I had the bouillabaisse, which was divine. The tamales were smothered to perfection. The meat inside could melt in your mouth. The sides complimented the overall flavor, and the plate was fairly large, though not enough that the price was justifiable. The bouillabaisse was delicious. The broth was warm, not overly tomatoe-y (if that's even a word) and the amount and quality were about right for the price point. ($25.00.)

Laura and Oscar waited and bussed on us Sunday evening around 7:00pm. Both were incredibly nice, considerate, and honest. The service here would have been perfect had our food not taken over half and hour to get to us. Laura had to check on the kitchen a couple times before anything came to our table. I was feeling very sick that day, so my irritability came as swift as the drink refills did. I cannot at all blame either server, though. They took care of us and did everything in their power to make us happy. Great personalities.

After forty minutes the food arrived. I then ordered the flan with chocolate cake, however they were out of the cake portion. So I settled for the flan alone, instead. I like most flan in general, I'm not picky. I think it's all pretty smooth and wonderful. So when I took a bite of this dense little mound of rubber and water, I was so horribly disappointed. I thought maybe it might be due to me being sick (messing with my tastes and textures), but nonetheless it was just...not great. Presentation was bland. Flavors were off. Texture was just awful. The little gross place on the college campus provides better flan in their little plastic boxes (I'm 100% not over exaggerating). 

Overall, I was a tad bit agitated. More like disappointed. The food was so good, excluding dessert. And the service was great on the waiting staff, horrid on the kitchen. If you don't mind a wait, and want a hearty, romantic, authentic meal, then Leticia's is definitely the place for you.

UPDATE: The business owner was kind enough to explain their situation in the kitchen that day, and reached out to me asking to drop in again. That was insanely considerate and very sweet. I bumped my review up a star and definitely intend to stop back in for a bite. Nothing is more awesome than someone who is passionate about their business and food.

So this is now the 4th time that I have been here. The food is always pretty good but the service is ALWAYS really bad. The waiters and waitresses are very nice but the service is extremely slow ALWAYS. Waitress passed by our table multiple times and never once asked if we needed our drinks refilled. I had to ask 3 times for chip refills. Appetizer took forever to come out. Chimichanga was great! 

I have come here when it's been busy and slow and on different days and at night and the service always is sub par.

I understand the high star rating for the food but not for the service. I give it 4 stars for the food and a 1 star for the service.

This restaurant is amazing! We have lived here for about a year and just discovered it. We had the lunch special and then came back for dinner. Our group had tamales, enchiladas, carne asada,, tacos, tostadas, a burrito, chips, and salsa. And everything was amazing! The food is of the highest quality and the service was terrific and the price's are very reasonable. I am picky with the cleanliness of restaurants, and this place is extremely clean. The decor is fun and lively. There is indoor, outdoor and bar seating. I will definitely be returning a lot!

Awesome place, fresh chips accompanied with salsa verde, a deep dark roasted salsa and yes warm bean dip, yum! Had the chile verde, rice and beans, one of the best chile verde dishes I've ever eaten. My bro asked our server Cecilia if the had vegetarian and she tells us they can do anything vegetarian his meal was awesome too, cheese enchiladas, black beans and rice. She was awesome too!!

If your in Northern  end of Vegas off the 95 you have to stop her

This place was a nice little gem in an area we had not been aware of before.  On a cute, quaint street.  The bar offered NFL game time happy hour with really delicious margaritas for the price and the food was delicious.  Our waitress was really nice and the restaurant was very well decorated.  There was a nice little patio area which we would enjoy relaxing and eating at on a normal day, but we were interested in the game at that time.  Great place, would go back again!

P.S. Happy hour special is only at the bar.

We stumbled across Leticia's by a wrong turn, but we are glad we found it! We stopped in for lunch- the food is authentic and they serve complimentary chips with salsa and bean dip, my boyfriend and I ordered house margaritas which were quite tasty and then we shared a carne aside platter. The food was delicious, definitely recommend trying the cilantro rice- it was great! Our service was very friendly and always attentive. I really enjoyed our experience and the atmosphere was very fun!
After an hour and a half of sitting and waiting for our food, we ended up leaving disappointed.  The kitchen was totally understaffed and who knew when our food would have come.  So disappointing!

This place is always so nice and child friendly. The food is great, I've had the shrimp fajitas, carne Asada, but my favorite is the Oaxaca cheese and shrimp tacos! It has chipotle sauce and cheesy poblano rice. The margaritas are also great.

I came to Las Vegas and was really hungry and I saw a Mexican cocina and my family decided  to go in and try it Should've turned around and gone to DEL TACO down  the street.  way overpriced, food has no taste very dry tacos are like eating cement . If you want real street tacos go to a corner stand . Why is this place still in business. Adios never again can't wait to go to king taco

The only reason why I was on this side of town was because my best friend was working over here and he wanted to have lunch. I haven't seen him in forever and he said he wanted some mexican food. I chose Leticia's because my sorority sisters suggested (and they are mexican) this place! They said it was a nice sit down restaurant with some really good food. So, of course we had to check it out!

It's located in a beautiful area (super far from my house) in north town. I was surprised! The outside atmosphere looked like a really nice place to sit outside. It was really hot weather at the time so we went inside and got greeted right away from two beautiful ladies! We were seated immediately at a booth. It's really authentic looking decor. Lots of awesome designs and fun things to look at all around the room. Our booth was kinda small for the three of us, but we managed. The two waiters we had were super nice! They spoke in spanish (and my friend spoke spanish as well since he worked in Chile the past two years) so it was pretty awesome to watch! I love mexican food! They started us off with a bowl of chips with two different salsas and beans. They even refilled it if we ever wanted some more! Now time for the hard part. Choosing what to eat. The menu is filled with so many options!

I decided to go with the lunch specials. There were a bunch you could choose from, and I got the burrito lunch special enchilada style with verde sauce on top. It came with lettuce, tomato, beans, and mexican rice. Boy was it super yummy! The burrito was smothered in sauce and cheese. I had to use cholula sauce to add a bit of flavor. The atmosphere inside was really fun. The waiters constantly checked up on us. They even had me try the spiciest sauce there, and MAN was I burning up!!! You should definitely try it if you want a KICK!

They were kind enough to offer dessert which looked delicious, but we turned it down because we were so stuffed from our entree. If you are in this area and want some awesome mexican food other than a chain fast food stop, definitely try this place out! Definitely glad that we did.
Really enjoy this place. The place is cozy and inviting. The food is yummy and the prices are decent.
Saturday nights from 8:30-11pm is karaoke. The ambiance and service are exceptional!! They have the most amazing bean dip that comes free with chips and salsa! Great food!
The food was delicious, the service was superb. I would highly recommend this restaurant.
Yuck.  Roberto's quality with casino pricing. Service wasn't bad but will definitely pass on eating here again.

Morri runs such a clean, well managed floor! The steak ranchera was excellent! Moist and flavorful, with the perfect amount of heat. Free mimosas on mother's day was the perfect touch!  Thanks for everything, guys!

Some of the best Mexican food we've ever had! We love going here. Great atmosphere, wonderful service, & the food is delicious!
Everything we've tried is so good!

Based on a tip from someone else, I was anxious to try this place. Unfortunately, I was extremely disappointed  There were several large groups that arrived before me. I had to wait literally 30 minutes for my food.  My server was nice and apologized several times for the delay.  When my steak tacos came, they were dry. Luckily, my server Joanne, checked back with me fairly quickly and offered to change my order for something else.  Luckily the replacement order came very quickly. Joanne chatted with me briefly when I finished my meal. I would have liked to see a discount (or even a dessert on the house) placed on my final bill for my inconvenience.  A while back, I went to Red Robin and my burger was overcooked.  Not only did the manager come over and offer me a soup while I waited for a replacement, she took the burger charge off the bill without me asking. This is the service that I come to expect.  I'm not sure if I will return to Leticia's again. I've been to Michocan Gourmet Mexican restaurant twice and both times, I've gone the food and service was excellent.

Had the Sopa de Mariscos, and it was delicious! If you love seafood, you will love it. It has prawns, clams, mussels, tilapia, and even a lobster tail all in a spicy seafood broth. Come early, the place tends to get very crowded around 6pm and there is usually long wait out the door from that point.
Very friendly and very tasty. Worth the trip . And it's nice to have a nice restaurant up here 95 & Durango for a change!

Food is fabulous!!! Almost as good as my moms...
The flavors from home. The service is always excellent!!
We have been coming here for 5 years now and absolutely love it. Food is always great and service as well. Weekends can be quite a wait but worth it. Haven't been disappointed with a single meal.

I felt the food was good but I didn't like the service and the constant sweeping near our table. The service wasn't good at all. Waitress was rushed and I felt like I was bothering her for asking for napkins which we didn't have. 

I will continue to order" to go" so I can relax in my home without the hustle and bustle atmosphere and lack luster service.
This neighborhood Mexican restaurant is the best. Great food and awesome service. This is our favorite place to eat Mexican food!
The food was great the atmosphere and service were good.  The only downside was waiting 15 minutes for the bartenders who had 2 people at the bar to make my drink.

Best Mexican food in town!   Ice cold beer, great margaritas and amazing appetizers.  We've been going here regularly since it opened. We've had a couple times in 5 years an order came out not to our liking and they've either fixed it, replaced it or refunded it without hesitation.  There's often a wait (for good reason) but it's worth it.  Don't look for ground beef and yellow cheese here. The authentic recipes come with queso and shredded beef.  They make a rice with green chile's and cheese that's to die for!  Yummy!  Given a choice by the family I always choose Letecias.  Quite honestly, I would have given it 5 stars but the servers are hit and miss.  There are a few there, Luciano and Amy for example,  that are exemplary.   But others are only mediocre in there attention and service at times so for that I took off a star.

I come here often but never leave a comment nor check in... Well, it's that time. I like to sit in the corner what I call and tell the greeter "the dark side" it's more relaxing. I love the Shrimp Ala Diabla, the Steak Salad (dinner portion of course), carne asada enchilada and I never fail to order the  chicken consome. I eat in different Mexican restaurant but being close to work, I make sure I stop by here before heading home of break for lunch whenever I crave for the taste. Great food, Great Service!!!
I love the food. But the service seems to be lacking the last few months. The last 3 times it took forever for drinks, chips, food and check! I love the food it's what keeps us coming back.

We were recently visiting Las Vegas for a conference. We drove up to Mount Charleston sight-seeing and decided to check Yelp for food in the area. We're so glad we found this restaurant!! It was so delicious, and the service was so very friendly and nice.
I chose beef fajitas. They were quite tasty, and I really enjoyed the zucchini and mushrooms that were included in the vegetable mix. 
At the end of the meal, one of the owners thanked us for coming in, and we mentioned we were from Nashville. He then had Leticia come over to meet us. They both seemed genuinely pleased to have visitors from so far away. Leticia then surprised us with a free serving of flan to share. It was so completely wonderful--the perfect consistency and taste! Delicious!! 
I've never felt so welcomed in a place. I look forward to visiting again. It's definitely worth the drive from the Las Vegas strip.
The food and the service was very good and the staff was friendly. Best Mexican food that we have had in Las Vegas so far.

Great food, reasonable prices.  I love the fact that you get chips and three different types of salsa as part of your meal.  I could (and frequently do) fill up on them.  The food is high quality and seems more authentic than your typical Mexican restaurant.  Leticia's has a nice outdoor seating area that I like to take advantage of when the weather permits.  The service has always been very polite and professional, but can be very slow at times, hence the minus one star.
One of the best things about living in the Northwest is that we are down the street from Leticias.  Great service and the freshest, best Mexican food in the City.

In my experience with Mexican restaurants, you can never find that perfect place.  One place might have the best chips & salsa, as other places have better margaritas, while another place might have the best fish tacos. 

 With that being said, Leticia's definitely has the best Carnitas in Vegas.  Overall, I think their food is excellent.  They have some of the most tender, flavorful Carnitas I have ever eaten.  I've also had their Carne Asada burrito and the Milanesa; both where the steak was also tender and flavorful, and not tough and chewy.  I've had better chips & salsa at other places, but I can't complain when it's free (part of the meal).  Of the numerous visits, I've only had one visit with slow service, and our food took 30 minutes to come out from the time we ordered.  All other visits, the service was great and the food came out fast.  Prices are decent for lunch specials, but I haven't eaten dinner there yet.
I haven't been disappointed with the food there yet, and I would recommend this place to anyone.  It is located way up in the Northern part of Vegas, so it's not conveniently located (unless you live up there).  But if you love Carnitas, then you have to check out Leticia's.
Great atmosphere and service.  Up scale Mexican food, good presentation. Great margaritas. Chips and dips were very good.
Excellent food, friendly service, affordable prices, close to home. My only complaint was that the Margarita's were a bit weak, very tasty though, just weak IMO.

Eh, it was just okay.  I really wanted to LOVE this place, but it just wasn't what everyone cracked it up to be.  

The chips weren't warm, and the salsas all tasted the same.  

The chile rellenos (I had the cheese and also the beef stuffed rellenos) are not even worth rating as average.  They were severely undercooked, and normally you don't need to take in a knife to cut rellenos.  I was literally cutting through what seemed like raw chile.  The rellenos we have at our employee dining room tastes better than theirs.  And Leticia's is not cheap.  

Their award-winning tacos were delicious however, and that's what warranted them that extra star.  Their fried ice cream was also very good.
