Some may quibble at the lack of authenticity or "overpackaging" (regarding presentation and decor), but the atmosphere is fun and the food is good.  On my visit a couple of days ago, service was a little bit slow, but waitstaff were still nice and fairly accommodating.  Portions are large, prices are mid-range (i.e., not cheap but not wallet-breaking), and the free salsa and chips are really quite good!  Try the meatball soup for something warm and differently delicious.

Recently moved here from east coast. First time eating here. We had great service and the food was extremely good. Loved the tortillas and salsa. Could barely finish our meals. Will definitely bring our east coasts guests here when they visit. 
We will be eating here more and sitting outside as the weather gets warmer.

Leticia's used to be my favorite Mexian place - great food and friendly fast service. Went there Saturday eve about 5 p.m., so before the huge weekend rush and the service was horrible. Staff seemed like we were bothering them by wanting a water refill and more chips. One of our party did not get her food until the rest of us were done eating AND we had to ask for her food 3 times. They kept checking, but never came back. 

The food quality was not as good either, even with higher prices. 

Sadly it's just not worth going there anymore.

Wow!  The food here is not only original but delish!  The ambiance of the restaurant makes you feel like you could be in a little restaurant in little Mexico.  Amazing experience and the service is the best.  Very attentive,  knowledgeable,  helpful and willing to go out of their way to keep you happy.  Definitely coming back.

Today was our first time here! I am so happy we came! Great service, amazing flavors, and full stomachs!  They even took the time to explain the menu! 

I will definitely come back! Very authentic with a modern twist!

AMAZING!!! 

BEST Bloody Mary's EVER!! 
BEST homemade mozeralla!!

The food is just perfect!
Excellent food and great customer service!  Will always come back!  Great staff and the highest level of service. Thanks guys!
Best fajitas in vegas.  By far!!!  Queso fundido is great too.  I loved visiting this place as a resident.

3 of us went to celebrate Cinco De Mayo  as Leticia's promoted it stating at 3 PM. Our reservations were for 5PM and we were seated promptly which was terrific. The meals and margaritas were great, but there were no Mariachi/Mexican music to be heard. We saw a Mariachi band outside when we left, but music from the 60's was being played. We were really hoping to get into the celebration, but without the Mariachi/ Mexican music, it was a bummer.

NOT impressed!  Big pieces of fat in my pork burrito, wife's "puffy" tacos were anything but puffy taco shells (seemed more like pita bread).  Beans and salsa weren't flavorful and they simply cost too much for the tasteless food that they serve.  Won't be going back!
I eat here regularly. The food is regularly good. The prices are slightly high. If you're looking to save a buck order your food ala cart and fill up on chips.

Wow.  The chips were very fresh and they give you three choices to dip them in - a fresh chipotle salsa, refried beans, and a fresh cilantro green salsa.   We ate almost all of them.  We ordered from the lunch menu which is affordable.  The chile verde is some of the best I have ever tried.  Tender and flavorful.  The taco salad was also good.  Portions were more than adequate especially after eating a whole bowl of chips.

Service was very good.  The waitress was very helpful and had good suggestions.  We were a little in a hurry and she was attentive and got us served quickly.  We didn't lack for anything. We sent with a restaurant dot com coupon for lunch and it was accepted without issue.  I see that they have coupons on Yelp which I might buy because I will be back here again.

At leticias with the family. Celebrating my husbands birthday. This place is amazing so far....We are hooked- haven't even gotten our dinner- and the salsa beans and chips are to die for! Not to be to mention the fabulous people. Great service- friendly environment. Authentic and worth every penny. 
This is a must go to restaurant !! 
All the Donayres

I've eaten at Leticia's close to a dozen times over the past couple of years, but noticed that food quality hasn't been consistent. After not dining here for 3-4 months, a group of friends and I decided to meet for lunch today and try it again. The chips, salsas, and beans were great as usual. I shared the empanadas (1 chicken tinga, 1 beef), Mexican corn, and had a bite of carne asada chimichanga. It was all good, but for the prices ($15 for the chimichanga burrito!) I feel it's not a great value. 
The main area of concern was the service. After being seated it took 15 minutes for someone to take our drink order (water and iced tea), and an additional 20 minutes for the drinks to be delivered. Granted it was a Saturday afternoon, but it's standard to have at least waters brought out within 15 minutes of a party being seated. When we politely asked our server about the drinks, she made some excuse about the bartender being busy. Not cool Leticia's, not cool.

The only thing I actually liked about this place was an employee named Hector, nice old guy who was really working hard. I should have known this place would be trouble as soon as I saw the bartenders pouring premade margaritas out of a jug. So gross. The food was also not good, not good at all. It was over priced and very generic. Having lived in Mexico for a year, I was expecting so much more. We moved in right down the street and had been excited to try this establishment, but we will not be going back.

Tonight I tried something new. The "El Molcajete". It's a tomato, garlic, jalapeño sauce made fresh in a scalding hot lava rock bowl with grilled steak, shrimp and grilled cactus. Served with fajita sides it was spicy and very good. My wife and I could share it easily. If you are like me get the habanero salsa as a side and bump up the spice. Great different meal.
Since I've moved to Vegas from NY this is probably the most delicious & authentic tasting Mexican food I have had so far. The restaurant is cute, great service, great food & awesome dessert!

Fantastic food as always! And great waiter.  But the front hostesses need to pay better attention to how long patrons are waiting. For just 2 people - took over 2 hours for dinner!  Told us about a 15 minute wait. 45 minutes later asked how much longer.  All I got was a "woops".  Even though food is great, won't go back. Front staff really needs to be much better.

Went here with low expectations and it didn't let me down . Bartender was odd to put it nice . If I had a staff member that said is food good or bad I would let then know it isn't cool to put negative thoughts in customers heads . Also shouting out soy sauce is secret ingredient was super lame because that's all I tasted after it was said . Place has potential but needs to get back to basics of customer service.

Amazing food and service.  Authentic Mexican In Vegas!!
Walter recommended the Enchilada Del Mar.  Without a doubt the best rice I have ever tasted.  The chips and salsa were great too. Two kinds of salsa and beans were served to us with homemade chips yum!  Everything is made from fresh ingredients.  We definitely will be back!  The best Mexican food in the valley and I am a native.
Make sure you get the fried ice cream caramel mixed with chocolate

I had lunch here with my wife and two year old twins. We arrived at 11:00am on Saturday right after the restaurant opened. The food was excellent. I had a breakfast burrito and my wife had chicken tamales. The chips were great and came with three different salsas. 

The service was also excellent, however there were only about five other customers since we were there so early. 

If this was located closer to my house I would be here all the time. I will have to settle for stopping by whenever I am lured to the northwest part of town
An absolute gem. Everything we ordered came out exactly as ordered. Our waiter was atentave but not a bother. Drinks were generous and we'll made. Will definately make this a go to spot for Mexican.

Food is beyond fantastic. I love their shredded beef tacos. Chips and salsa is on point too. Only things preventing 5 stars is 1) it could be a little cleaner inside and 2) service isn't great...usually just okay.

Leticia and her staff does not disappoint. Phenomenal FOOD, DRINKS and SERVICE. Everything on the menu is extremely fresh and has the taste of traditional home cooking. Drafts beer, full bar and one amazing bartender. Sal constantly gives remarkable service and great drinks.

Hit or miss. The last time we went here, we walked out. Food is alright, nothing special. Some servers take pride in their work, but the most recent had an attitude. We downed the chips and salsa waiting for our meal and as we were drinking margaritas wanted to continue to nibble. We asked for more. This was strange as they customarily bring new before you are out... They refused to bring more and basically ignored us. They were not out of chips as they continued to bring them to new tables being sat. I went to the bar to inquire again and was told they would be right out. 5 minutes passed and then we were told our food was almost ready so we didn't need more. What!?! We paid for our margaritas and promptly exited the building.

Great place to come and have margaritas food very authentic where else can you get a corn on the cob with crema,  chili powder, lime, cities cheese. Justin the bartender is great always attentive tasty drinks
Good Food, Fast Service and a pretty good Happy Hour menu all around.  Will go back again.  Margaritas were very good as well!

Where do I start!! The food CAN'T be beat. The service is ALWAYS kind professional and courteous. Walter is my go to waiter for this establishment. This man bends over backwards to please you. Walter is the BEST!! If you love Mexican fare this is the only stop you have to make PERIOD!!

I had heard rave reviews about this spot, so thought I'd surprise my hubby with a new place. Got there a little earlier than their 11:00 opening time, and so we walked around the little shops until just a few minutes before 11:00. As we were standing at the front door, I looked again at the open times sign, and there was a tiny (german) cockroach actually crawling between the glass and the sign INSIDE! Needless to say, we high tailed it without going in.. If there is a cockroach that usually hides from the light in full sight on the door, I can only imagine what's inside!

I have been in Vegas for 7+ years and easily tried 25+ Mexican restaurants.  My search has officially ended.  The salsa is very good, the service is always spot on.  Portion size is enough to take home left overs.  Fried ice cream is wonderful and the menu choices are varied.  And of course the margaritas are always a hit. 

It is nice to see a 'neighborhood' place that is usually busy 5 nights out of 7.  I imagine this encourages the staff to stay on as there are many familiar faces there week after week, month, etc.

Also, love to know that Leticia is in the kitchen--this is not some phantom great Aunt twice removed on the brother's side....who passed down her recipes.

Thank you, Leticia's.  I have been to the restaurant twice.  Both experiences were excellent.  The food was good, the staff was as friendly as they could be.  Friends had recommended the restaurant and it lived up to expectations.  That would be enough, but Leticia's also sponsors community events.  They are having a cinco de mayo festival and concert in the neighborhood on May 6.  It is a great restaurant but they also build the community and get people together around where the restaurant is located.  Again, thank you for what you are doing.  I will eat here again.

Great vibe and good food. Chile relleno came out awesome. Definitely recommend it for the for the margaritas. It's in a really cool shopping center as well. The only reason it didn't get 5 is because of our order being incorrect initially. It happens and I would still go back.

This place is excellent! Best Mexican restaurant in town, amazing street tacos (I recommend the Al Pastor) and great margaritas. Never had a bad experience here, the staff is always prompt and friendly, only downside is they can be very busy around dinner time on the weekends so prepare for at least a 40 minute wait.

The restaurant sits on the corner of a cute plaza with parking at the front and back.  The outside is very inviting and at night the lights come on and make it very romantic. The inside is filled with great South American decor and the colors are warm and comforting. Try the enchiladas and their tacos. The servers and host were very friendly and courteous too.

Second review:  I had to give this one another shot due to the carnitas being so good, but this will be my last time going there. Food is good so I can't knock them on that, but the service by Saul is some of the worst. I've been in the restaurant business for over 20 years and this guy might be one of the worst servers I have ever encountered. He is a disgrace to people in the industry. All he does is smile like an idiot to your face, because he is clearly overwhelmed all of the time. He went from a buss boy to a server which was a poor decision on behalf of management, but even worse is that they keep him in a position that he will never succeed at. What makes me most upset about this place is the lack of management or ownership presence. The restaurant appears to always be busy, and it's because it takes and hour and a half for a three top to get entrees only. Pathetic!  
They truly need the help of a good consultant to go in and show them how to be operators of their business since it's clear that they are not capable of managing this place themselves. It is currently doing good volume, but if another place in the area opens up that is decent I don't think this place will make it which is sad. The lack of ownership presence on the floor shows they have no respect or appreciation for the customer. Good restauranteurs are involved in their business during peak times so they can evaluate what the business needs to improve on. It's clear they aren't watching their social media reviews which are done by customers taking time out of their busy day to tell them either what they are doing well or what they need to improve on. 7-12-16

Update: After this review was posted the GM emailed me with a response to how things were handled. I appreciate the fact that they take reviews seriously, and the importance of customer feedback. Great job! I had to raise my review from a 1 star to  a four star, because they do have great food and that's the reason most people go out to eat. 

First review:
I frequent this place a couple times per month because the carnitas are very good. 
My last few experiences have been less than stellar. Customer service has fallen off drastically, and there is no management presence so the staff does whatever they want. Nobody has ever come back to ask how everything is and if they can get anything else before they bring the bill. The last time I was in which was yesterday the very inexperienced server rang in both orders incorrectly and when we finally had to track him down it took another 25 minutes to get one carnitas taco. How it takes 25 minutes to put pre cooked meat on a flour tortilla with some onion and cilantro is mind blowing. There was no manager to complain to. It took an hour and a half for two people to eat which makes it clear why it always looks busy in there because they don't turn tables very fast. 
GET YOUR SHIT TOGETHER!

I'm not one to give out five stars unless I feel a place earns it and honestly this is the best Mexican restaurant in town, considering this is the only Leticias in town. This isn't your typical chain restaurant.

The environment inside is very nice. Decor matches the obvious theme, the lighting is at a slight dim and the bar has a sort of cantina look to it. Every time I've been the staff has always been pleasant and personable, always willing to strike up conversation besides the typical "What can I get for you?" routine.

The first thing they bring out are tortilla chips made in house, along with bean dip, verde salsa and a black salsa. The chips and dips are so good that you can get full from eating so many, they are that delicious. They have a crisp airy taste and taste like they just finished making them. When I say the chips are baked in-house, you can genuinely taste that they are. Amazing way to start a meal.

My first visit there I ordered the Milanesa and man was I blown away. Everything seemed to be cooked perfectly. The portions are huge so unless you come with an appetite plan on leftovers. My second visit I ordered the quesa shrimp tacos and just when I thought their food couldn't get better these tacos proved me wrong. The only way I can describe their food is to let your taste buds do all the talking for me. I decided to try out their dessert and their tres leches is delicious. I was given complimentary coffee with it which was an amazing gesture in my book. Be sure to check in as sometimes you'll get a free treat to top your meal!

Overall, this place takes the cake when it comes to Mexican dining. Prices can get a tad steep but I'm okay for paying a little more when the food is well worth it. A++ in my book.
One of my favorite Mexican restaurants in Vegas. The chips and salsa was really good, and in really enjoyed the atmosphere.  My only complaint is the service is really slow.

The food was delicious and flavorful.  There's definitely a good variety for any pallet and while it's a bit pricey for each dish, I'd say it's worth it.  What I'd really like to give 5 stars and come back for is one of the newest "bus-boys", Hector.  He's is one of the most charming, interesting, and suave people I've ever had the privilege to encounter. Such a kind old gentlemen and he reminded me of an exact (however more refined) version of Kill Bill's father figure, Esteban Vihaio.  The interaction with him between meals is what left myself, and my friend, enchanted and buzzing from the experience of Leticia's.  I've been there a few times before, but I may find myself going back sooner just to interact with this sweet gentlemen.

Fantastic restaurant!  BEST Mexican food ever!  Our appetizers and entrees were phenomenal and awesome margaritas too!  Ask for Maria, she's the only "Maria" there, great service and she had great recommendations!  We had the Mexican corn, enchiladas, chile rellanos, and this awesome seafood "pot" filled with clams and Lobster...oh soooo good!   Can't wait to go back!

Leticia's USE to be a great place for Mexican food, unfortunately no longer. The service is very slow and sporadic at best. The food lately has been just ok, and the quality has definitely gone down hill. We enjoy eating at local places, non chains and are very disappointed in the direction this restaurant is going.

Best Mexican food in Las Vegas, hands down! My only complaint was the hostess, don't remember her name, but she was the worst hostess ever.  LOTS of empty tables available but she choose to not seat them and make customers wait up to 1/2 hour for a table.  Poor management skills.  Food was delicious!  Can't say enough good things about this place.  If you go on the weekend, just plan to wait awhile for a table.  Its worth the wait though!

Amazingly, it has been a very difficult journey trying to find what I would consider a phenomenal Mexican restaurant in this town. I know because I have been searching for over 4 years with no luck, until today. I got a tip about Leticia's Mexican Cocina just yesterday. It is a very long way away from my house, but I felt good enough about the tip to drive all the way across town today to check it out for lunch. I ordered make your own combo which I chose the noodle soup, chicken enchilada with red sauce, beef tostada and added in an extra of Carne Asada.
Lunch started two very good salsa's and warm bean dip, and was quickly followed up with a very tasty tomato noodle soup!
The main course was nothing short of excellent. My fav was probably the carne Asada, but the other two were excellent as well. The beans and rice were a very nice compliment! The great news is that it is far and away the best Mexican food in Vegas in my opinion!!! My waiter, Walter was also great... Taking care of all my needs! The bad news is that it is 40 minutes away from my house, but I will be scooping up all my friends and diving back over to enjoy often!!! There was a group of 6 first timers across from me and all agreed that it wad thumbs up from everyone. One gal said I am glad I live in Cali or I would be huge if I lived close!!!

I really do not understand all the rave reviews.  I guess this is definitely a "love" or "hate" type of place.  And I am definitely in the latter group.  I can only imagine my disappointment and confusion had I read the reviews before eating at this restaurant.

We went on a Sunday around 2:00.  The hostess was unfriendly and unwelcoming, but nonetheless we were seated quickly.  The restaurant look and feel is very average.  No unique decor, no ambiance, just your basic looking food house.  Very misleading from the outside appearance, in my opinion.

As I perused the menu, I was particularly struck by all of the specific rules, guidelines, directives, footnotes, etc.  Split plate charges (even on kids meals!), drink substitution upcharges, different type of rice charges, etc.  I actually read the whole menu cover to cover because it was so silly.  I actually found myself wondering if the chips and salsa would be charged to us, or not refilled for free.  Hey, I understand businesses have to make money, but the food is already way overpriced and expensive, the special rules just make it absurd.

Anyway, so the super tiny basket of tortilla chips and 3 varieties of salsa/dip were brought to our table by an apathetic busgirl.  The waiter soon followed and placing our orders was an easy, quick process.  We ate the chips in about 4 minutes, so we flagged down the busgirl to get a refill.  I was surprised to learn that the chips and salsa were, in fact, complimentary (haha), but we ended up receiving our first refill after our food was already delivered to the table (so about 20 minutes from the time we asked).  Which, hey, great, we didn't fill up on chips and salsa, right?

So, I had an order of ceviche and a carnitas street taco.  The ceviche was fine.  Not good, not bad.  Just basic.  The street taco was absolutely disgusting.  At first, I was impressed with the amount of meat, but when I realized it was very little meat and mostly globs of fat, I quickly lost my appetite.  That was made worse when I smelled my husband's ground beef tacos, which, I swear, smelled like cat food.  My husband, who eats everything, ate about a half of his taco.

In the end, we chalked this up to a "learning experience," and paid our bill and left.  We are not the type to complain to try and get something for free.  I sent in feedback online, because I think it's important for the owners to know the details, but I haven't heard back.  I can't say I'm surprised, and I will never step foot in this restaurant again.
This place is seriously the best. Delicious food, awesome service and adorable decor inside and out!

Saturday evening we used a YELP reservation and were seated promptly. The place was packed with a large line of others waiting for a table!

1) Excellent service that "deserved" more than a standard tip.

2) Broad range of interesting menu choices.

3) Every item we ordered deserved a minimum of a "B" with most of them deserving an "A"!

4) Price was more than fair considering all the above comments I've shared.
Just wanted to give some props to Luciano! Thanks for the 5+ years of great service!!! Thanks Luchi!!

I love this place.  It is my new favorite in the Northwest.  Everything is fresh.  No canned foods and prepackaged ingredients.  You can taste the difference.  Had the grilled fish street tacos today and they were excellent.  I am still craving them tonight!  My husband loves the puffy tacos.  They are tacos in shells similar to the shell you get on a Tostada salad.  Looked yummy.  Carnitas and Carne Asada platters are great choices as well.  Large portions so you can take some home for lunch the next day.

Nice restaurant, comfortable outdoor seating, very good service.  I liked this place, I would definitely come back for a drink and some chips and salsa.  My problem with it tough; is the prices.   Not that it's wildly expensive, but I ended up paying around $15 per entree, for the same Mexican food I'd get at a mom and pop shop for like $6.  Go for the atmosphere, not a quick fix to satisfy a Mexican food craving.

Simply delicioso! Was looking for some authentic flavors with a home-cooked comfort-food feel and we definitely found that here. Chips and salsa to start- the green salsa was so good that we finished off two baskets of chips before our food even came out.
Rib eye crispy tacos- comes with 2 for an entrée. A little greasy but can be good hang over food. The rib eye was very tender and juicy. Yum all around
Chipotle fajita tamales- Definitely get the green sauce. Good vegetarian option- filled with onions, bell peppers, and mushrooms. 
OMG Churros! Sinfully sweet and coated with cinnamon sugar. Served with chocolate and caramel dipping sauces on the side. Perfect way to end your Mexican fiesta meal.

This was our first and last time we go t ok this restaurant.  Way over priced for what you get.  They do not tell you that what you are getting has additional charges. And what you get in the first place is not with the price before or after the additional charges.  Nothing at all to write home about. Just another Mexican restaurant. They say they are rated the number one taco in Las Vegas....no I think not!  We will not be go ok g back. There are other Mexican restaurants that are much better bad more reasonably priced!

We went to Leticia's on a Friday night. They were very busy, but we went right to a table. We felt the service was just mediocre (Mario was our waiter). One of our 4 people had to send their food back, it was cold. One person ordered enchiladas in a red sauce and received it with a white sauce. When we told the waiter, the waiter said "Well don't you even want to taste it?" NO! we just want what we ordered to begin with. Their red sauce tastes like a mild mole sauce, which was not all that good. I ordered a taco and it was pretty good, but beans and rice were cold. It was higher priced than most places, which would have been ok, had it been good!
We will not go back!!!!!!!!!
Awesome Mexican food. Mole way better than any other place in the valley. Chile rejeno was superb.
4 for now. The food was good! Definitely different than what we're used to but good!! They dealt with my child which is enough to say the least. Margarita on the rocks was bangin!
My family, coworkers and friends visit regular for both lunch and dinner since their opening, great food, service and atmosphere.

Am visiting Las Vegas for a basketball tournament.  Had a few hours in between games, Mexican sounded good.  

Found Leticia's in the area after a quick search.  When I walked in, the place has an odd smell, maybe it was the furniture or ventilation?  It wasn't an encouraging first impression.

Decor is nice, wood furniture with lots of Windows.  Service very friendly.

When the chips and salsa came, it came with a red, green and bean dip.  Both salsas had excellent flavor and respectable spice level without burning your mouth.  Love bean dip, but this one had a hint of cloves which I don't generally care for.  It grew on me, however, I wondered if all the sauces were going to have "twists" on the traditional versions.

I ordered one chicken enchilada green sauce, one shredded beef in red sauce, and one crispy tacos.  When it came out, I got concerned again, since the presentation was really nice.  In my experience, the Mexican places with fancier presentation often lack authenticity. I usually go for no fanfare.  

To my surprise however, the chicken enchilada may have been the best I ever had.  Fresh bright flavor including fresh oregano, tart tomatillo sauce and really tender chicken breast.  Generous amount of meat too.

The shredded beef was super tender and flavorful, and the taco shells were lightly fried just the way I do them at home.  Both very good, although the chicken enchilada was the star on this day.

I'm really picky about authenticity, and Letticia's pleasantly surprised me at every turn.  I don't know if I'll ever be back in this remote area, but the locals have themselves a gem in this one.

If you're a stickler for quality and authenticity like I am, you'll really appreciate this place.  

Immaculate bathroom for bonus points lol...it matters.

If you love Mexican food, I totally recommend this spot. The food is amazing and the service is great. 

The first time I came here I wasn't sure if I'd like the food and plus it was a Friday night, at least the wait wasn't too long (about 20 min) and hey it was happy hour. 

When we sat down, the server approached us and introduced herself and took our drink orders. I wasn't too sure what to try because they all seemed delicious. I ended up ordering the Ribeye Tacos...YUM! My cousin ordered the tamales and I had a little sample...totally worth trying.

The second time I came here I tried the Quesa Tacos because the server said it was one of the best items on the menu and I wouldn't be let down. He was right!! I ordered the Quesa Tacos with carne asada with a side of queso rice; I totally recommend trying it and trust me you can probably share because the tacos are pretty filling and the rice is amazing. 

The third time I came here I tried the shrimp tacos (grilled), yeah I don't recommend it at all just because it was salty and just not that great. However, my cousin ordered the Empanadas and had a little bite of it and it was really good. 

BTW if you check if you get a free fried ice cream, so make sure you check in and show your server because dessert is a perfect way to end your meal.

I always enjoy visiting Leticia's. I love that they're located in my area. 

I especially enjoy going in the fall because they have outdoor seating. 

The food is always good. Typical menu...  I don't usually order margaritas, but I do enjoy them here. Their soup is always good. 

The service is friendly and the server comes by frequently. 

Worth checking out.

I went here a year ago with a date and we both got sick, Hershey highway kinda sick. So I had the opportunity to go again and I'm glad to say neither of us got sick this go around. We went for an early dinner late lunch 3pm, just thought I should mention that since maybe they weren't into the full cooking swing yet. I ordered the chicken fajitas and she ordered cheese enchiladas. It smelled great with the peppers and onions. Unfortunately the chicken had no seasoning, it was as if they just bought the chicken from Albertsons and grilled it with no spices. The beans tasted like Rosaritas straight out of the can. The cheese enchiladas Were hard on the tortilla edges. So we both agreed not to go there again. We could of cooked that same meal with more flavor for less. Just my opinion. I know others like this place but its just not for us.

I have never written a review; however, I can no longer let this opportunity pass by. My husband and I decided to celebrate our anniversary lunch at Leticia's. We have always had consistently amazing service, accompanied by the most authentic Mexican food we have found here in Las Vegas. The menu selection offers a wide variety of mouth watering options. Food arrived at our table steaming hot, mouth watering and very generous portions. We both highly recommend this treasure and will continue to celebrate special occasions here. Absolutely love the environment, service and delicious food!

This place is as authentic as it can get. The food is delicious and tastes like my mom made it...(shes a great cook). Their Jamaica (hibiscus) margarita is to die for. Love this place!!! We live in California and when were in Vegas which is more often that we like to be, we come here for dinner. Its a drive from the strip, but its so well worth it.
Everything was quite good and some of the best guac I've had in a long time. A tad pricy for Mexican, but yelp is there with an awesome discount to help.  I need to try the margaritas next time.

My wife and I had a great experience here. We live about as far away from this place as you can without leaving Las Vegas, but we were in the area and decided to give it a try. We are so glad we did, but sorry they are so far away. I had the shredded beef burrito and my wife had the carnitas. While we were asking the server questions she offered to bring us some samples of other meats. What? Hell yes. I was so impressed.  They chips and salsa also hit the spot. We highly recommend this place.
Great food and great service. The only reason I did not give five stars is because the environment is a little cramped. They definitely need more space.

Went to leticias last night for dinner before a show. We went around 4:40 in the evening and when we arrived we were told the wait would be 15 minutes. We were seated shortly after around 4:50 and we waited for our waiter to come take our drink orders. 10 minutes passes and no sign of our waiter. The hostess walked by us after seating another table and asked if we had been helped yet and we replied with a no. She brought us our chips and salsa and we still had not ordered drinks (we didn't even have water). Finally the lady who was refilling waters brought us some, but did not say a word to us and still no sign of a waiter. We waited about another 15 minutes and no one had even acknowledged us so we ended up leaving. Now I understand that it was a Saturday evening and they were busy, but to not even have someone say a word to us or bring us anything except for our hostess was pretty ridiculous! I was extremely disappointed and upset because they actually have really amazing food and I was looking forward to eating it. Definitely better to go around lunch time because you will actually be taken care of.

Ok I dunno what's happening but this place service wise is going down. Appetizers are ordered to eat before you get your meal not at the same time or mins before. It would also be nice if someone would come by to see if you need a water refill or more salsa. The owners would come by no matter how busy it was to see if everything was fine. Now its get in eat and get out.  So sad. Sometimes it's not always about quality food
This place is amazing! Enchiladas with green sauce a must have! I never wait in line for anything but for this place, I was willing to wait 30 minutes on a busy Friday night! Definitely worth it!

Me and my wife came here for an early lunch after leaving an appointment. We have been here before and it is always a really good eat. For lunch we both ordered the Carne asada. I ordered one of their house margaritas and as always I was not disappointed. The chips and salsa are really good, I would like for maybe a more spicy salsa as well though. Once our food arrived we both dug right in and devoured the steak because it's so delicious; juicy, tender, and easy to eat. I always love coming here and for a lunch meal it wasn't to bad only spent $30.

I normally love this place and it's ALWAYS packed on Friday and Saturday nights. Never ever had anything bad here... until just recently (night of 2/1/14). My bf ended up with massive food poisioning within 2 hours after having the shredded beef tacos. We'll go back eventually, but we won't be ordering those again. No one else at our table was sick, including me, as he was the only one to order the shredded beef. *also all foods consumed earlier in the day were all the same as each other so it was easy to figure out the cause.

We've lived in the neighborhood for a while and have passed Leticia's several times but never stopped in. Now I'm kicking myself for all the wasted time and mediocre Mexican food we've put up with elsewhere.

I was a little worried about how crowded it might be for a Saturday night, but we were able to sit down at the bar without a problem and our wait time for a table was reasonable. The staff were all very friendly and attentive, and it never hurts to have the bartender card you when you're nearly 20 years beyond the drinking age. 

The complimentary chips, salsas and bean dip were delicious. The food was good, though the only complaint I can come up with was not being able to find much of the guacamole in the enchilada I ordered. The shredded chicken was extremely tender if not a bit bland, but the lettuce and salsa on the plate were fresh and helped to pick things up a bit. The rice and beans (usually my favorite part of a Mexican dish), did not disappoint. 

Unfortunately the portion size was so large that we didn't have room for the fried ice cream we had planned on getting, but that just means we need to go back again soon.
We have been going here since it opened.  Last visit being 5/26 and we received NO bean dip with our chips.  One of my favorite things. I hope this was just a mistake. I was definitely disappointed!

The food wasn't terrible but was bland. The service wasn't bad, just slow. We were seated pretty quickly and even had our order taken quickly. The numerous amount of staff kept our drinks on full. Even often times refilling or brining new drinks when our drinks were still 75% full. In the end we felt that it was a cover up to how slow their food serving was. It took forever for our food to get to the table. We have been told that the timing is solely about taste and delivery but when we received our plates we wondered why they still lacked taste. My two cheese enchilada in red sauce plate was disappointing in all areas. The cheese was cluttered and not melted and the red sauce was overbearing. My husbands fajita plate was alright to his taste yet he said it was a little bland. All he received was a tablespoon of guacamole and when he asked if he could get a little more we joked about how he better not be charged for the additional tablespoon sized guacamole they brought to the table yet we were charged $2.50 which was ridiculous. Only saving grace to my disappointment was the two child plates. We ordered a child chicken enchilada meal and a child beef taco meal. Granted my kids both skipped on the rice and beans, they both ate their main dish which was a plus for me seeing as how my WHOLE plate went untouched and I was still charged and had to pay for mine. Definitely not worth it and won't be back. Which is really disappointing because upon being seated, another couple was raving about how they've been driving from Boulder City to come to this place for awhile....

Very disappointed. Chicken fajitas for two because we stopped eating beef about 6 months ago..it was chicken but it tasted like it was cooked in beef broth with broth on hot plate. We didn't eat it and when we questioned it were we told it was because of the mushrooms?

Mediocre Mexican restaurant. I've had better Mexican food from a truck. I went based on yelp reviews and was unimpressed even tho the restaurant was full. Not recommended to others and I love small businesses over chain Mexican restaurants.

Hidden gem with delish food! I could've eaten just the chips & salsa and been happy. The menu was a little tricky with the family style/individual format but we figured it out. The BF had quesataco which was different but really good. I love mole so when I got the option to pour it over taquitos, I was like hell yeah. I'll definitely be back!

This has quickly become one of my favorite Mexican restaurants. They have a good mix of classic Mexican dishes as well as some excellent specialties. The flautas remind me of the ones I had as a kid in San Diego. The house margarita was better than a lot of speciality drinks at other joints. On weekends the place gets a bit busy but I think that is a good thing. I know I'll be coming back a lot.

I can't say enough great things about this place.  I seriously miss it every time I go back home to Atlanta. 

Things to Know:

- The Salsa Macha is insanely good if you are into hot
- Justin the bartender is great at what he does.
- The bean dip is not vegetarian
- Chips are so yummm
- Open late :-)
- You should try the cafe olla
- All my clients love this place

I was here once a long time ago and then again about 6 weeks ago.

Apparently in the interim the management changed?

It was pretty solid the first time, but on the second visit I was waiting for a friend to show up (he did not, dork) so I had two baskets of chips with their amazing salsas, a couple of margaritas, and eventually a small dish that is escaping my memory at the moment (maybe more than a couple margaritas). It was delicious and amazing to the tune of "why have I not wandered into this place?" It's literally up the street, about a 15 minute walk, which comes in handy post-margarita...

Tara and Rudolfo behind the bar Monday and Tuesday, they were very cool, and the whole place appears to be stocked with nice employees from what I could tell.

Good stuff!

The best Mexican restaurant in Las Vegas !! 
same taste like Mexico City ... A+A+A+

I'm normally not on this side of town but I came here with a friend who was swearing by how great the food was and I wasn't disappointed.  I never knew there was a little nook of restaurants in this area but it's a nice area and the restaurant is big and completely Mexican while being interesting.  The bar area also has TV's for watching a game and enjoying a meal if you're so inclined.  

When I first sat down I was welcomed with chips that were still warm and toasty along with red and green sauces, and refried beans.  The lunch menu is a nice sampling of the dinner options and served with great proportions to be filling without overwhelming.  I had the Carnitas "Ma Pita" which was pork prepared in a way that I hadn't had since I was back home.  The spanish rice was warm, moist, and spiced with a nice tangy flavor.  The food was authentic and the service was attentive without being annoying and it was great to see a team effort of everyone helping your table and not just those that were assigned.  

I will be returning whenever I'm in the area and possibly even drive out there for dinner, and that says something since I normally don't exceed my zip code.

We used to love this place, and for years would have rated it 5 stars. Recently it has unfortunately changed for the worse. The food hasn't changed too much, but the service has gone down hill. There used to be a guy named Gustavo (if I remember correctly) he was awesome, and a really nice hostess, But I don't remember her name. Since they left everything changed. We have given the restaurant many chances, but we probably won't be back.

This is actually a really good authentic Mexican restaurant. I would reccomend to anyone. Their street tacos are ALMOST as good as real street tacos from the taco stand in the hood lol. If you go you gotta get dessert.! Best fried ice cream I've ever had! Yummy! Great atmosphere. Servers are friendly.

I should have left when we sat down at our dirty table... Chips were cold, stale, bean dip was cold and taste like it was from the can! The worst margarita I have ever tasted! It's way over priced and disgusting food.! I would've recommend this place at all! GROSS... Feeling so dissatisfied ;(

I'm a regular at Laticia's Mexican Cocina restaurant. Best Mexican food in town. Great margaritas, happy hour and friendly service. Tara makes unbelievable drinks and is a wonderful bar tender. Check it out. Enjoy.

Dissapointing. We arrived before our friends and saw the C rating health card posted at the counter, but obscured from view behind some free-standing advert plaquards .   We tried to persuade our friends to go elsewhere but they wanted to stay so we did as well.  We ordered elote corn,  a cheese quesedilla and a horchata.  the horchata was too sweet so I traded it for a soda.    The salsas were good but the chips tasted odd. The food took a while to be delivered to the table. The cheese in the quesedilla was too salty.  The elote arrived about five minutes later and was cold.  The service itself was pleasant.  Rating not withstanding, we won't be returning.

The service is great and the food is great! Right when you sit, they give you chips, salsa, and refried beans. Order the potato soup, its so good and its homemade.  It can get pretty busy on saturday nights, but it's worth the wait! There is a happy hour, monday-fridays, and you can get little appetizers for 2.50 each. Two of those usually get me full already.

My daughter recently told us about this jewel in the desert. We've lived here for 19 years and have searched for a GREAT Mexican restaurant since moving here. It is located in the far northwest of the valley, but luckily we live within 10 minutes away.

We dined here last night and it was everything I had hoped for.  We were seated right away, and we had our drink orders and chips served almost immediately. Our food server (waitress)  was wonderful, the margarita's were delicious and the chips/salsas/bean dip were freshly made (a bean dip, a smoky mild salsa, and a guacamole/cilantro smooth dip).
When the meal arrived, I knew before even taking the first bite, that it would be great. And it was.  We both ordered the shredded chicken enchilada's with Ranchera sauce (they offer other flavor sauces but we have been looking for Ranchera sauce with enchilada's for as long as we have searched for a restaurant.)  Our rice (Mexican rice) and refried beans were very tasty with a lot of good flavorings.

 The quaint little street the restaurant is located is designed beautifully, and the interior décor was very nice, and colorful. We will definitely be coming back.

This is the place for great Mexican food. I have yet to go wrong with anything on the menu. Chef is very creative and knows how to put together a fantastic plate. Chef Leticia has my utmost respect, the first time I had the opportunity to meet her, she was cleaning off a table, and expediting food for the kitchen. She took my order, allowed my changes, and cooked my food to my specifics, and then delivered it to my table, to make sure it was correct. How many Executive Chef's do you know, that would put that much effort into a plate, especially during a dinner rush? Leticia's has surpassed my expectations, and actually inspired me to cook better for my own family. The food is brilliant, the atmosphere is great, and the price is right!

Homeade mexican food close to my home!
Affordable, very good.
Place is open until later hours wich is a great choice for late dinner!
Friendly staff
I've died and gone to heaven. The food here is so flavorful. Service is great! Shrimp tacos are a must!

I was really looking forward to trying Leticia's after reading the other Yelp reviews, but our food was not good. There were 3 of us dining and 1 had the Milanese Chicken, which was absolutely horrible and almost inedible. The chicken was pounded so thin and pan seared that it was like a dried piece of chicken jerky.  The carne asada burrito was just okay (Cafe Rio is better and cheaper). I had the Taquito's, the potato and cheese was the only good thing about my dinner, the chicken taquito and the beef were both very dry and the meat was tough. Not including the tip dinner was over $60 (only 1 beer).  I would only go back for the potato and cheese taquitos.

The very best, authentic, home-style Mexican food you can buy , and that is only because grandma doesn't charge. Excellent service, great easy atmosphere, and very interactive, on site owners. Well worth a drive. Be hungry when you go. You will leave satisfied.

This is one of my all time favorite restaurants. Food is always amazing. I'm partial to the shrimp quesa tacos. Heavenly! Every entree I have tried is amazing. Great serving staff. Always willing to help. We are a very low maintenance family but they always go above and beyond. We eat here several times a month. Always a great experience. When we have friends in from out of town, we bring them here for a unique Las Vegas dining experience. No chains for us!

It's taken my wife and I 2 1/2 months to venture back to Leticia's to give it another try.  The food has always been outstanding, but service had always been an issue.  Not only is the food better than ever, the service was exceptional.  Thank you Tyler for such great service and to Leticia for the awesome food.  You'll see us much more often.

Feeling like GOOD Mexican food for dinner I had the idea of eating at Leticia's. We loved it so much the time we ate here before despite the ordeal we went through (see my previous review for details) that I knew it wouldn't be long before I had some of this yummy food in my tummy.

I was so pleased with the "Happy Hour Menu". It runs Mon-Fri from 3-6 pm. You can get margaritas 50% off! They have other food items starting at $2.50. We tried the "Cheese Quesadilla" and "Chorizo Taco". Both were well worth the regular menu price but getting them and just a great discount is just a bonus! They had other things like nachos, toastadas etc.

I tried the "Carnitas & Carne Asada Tacos" tonight and they were just so tasty. The rice that comes with it is good but the beans are the winner. The beans are thick and have great flavor.

The "Fried Ice Cream" is very yummy!

My experience as far as service and the food and restaurant are the same. Excellent.

I wanted to update my review to let others know about the happy hour menu and the quality and consistency of Leticia's.
My favorite Mexican sit down restaurant! Love the chips and salsa and anything I've had there. Excellent service!

EXCELLENT food! The chips and salsa are the best and I have had enchiladas, tacos, chorizo and eggs in the past and they are all delocious. My family and I will keep coming back to this neighborhood gem.
If you can get past the exceptionally slow service and the long wait times.... You'll find the food to be excellent.... Very flavorful.... Their "house " margaritas were very good....

I'd like to comment on the food, but for the second time in a row, they are closed before their posted time. This evening however, not only are they closed early, but their open sign was on and when we came to the door she told us they were closed. When I commented that the sign was on and the posted times said midnight, she proceeded to turn the sign off and slam the closed sign down. 5 paying customers....apparently, things are going so well, they don't need our business.  And we've eaten here before. The food was great and this time we brought newbies to try it out. Guess they'll never know.

Being from Mexico, it's hard to find good places like this one where they serve actual Mexican food.

The best thing was the Café de Olla, it's your average coffee with a hint of cinnamon flavor to it. 

Definitely a breakfast / brunch place, definitely worth the drive!
Love love love this place!!!!  Fantastic service, came from Phoenix to see my brother and we were treated so well here. Food was amazing, presentation was visually pleasing.
Tried this place on a hunch. Why couldn't all  of my gamble's payoff like this. Bartender and wait staff were great. Fajitas and tamales did not disappoint.
The service is great.   The chips and salsa are an amazing meal alone.  Our food was spot on as usual.  Thank god we are 5 minutes from such a place.

Normally the food and service is really good, but today it was sub-standard.  Seems like the carnitas burrito took forever to make and when it finally arrived the sauce on top was dried out.  We asked for more sauce on the side, but the waitress never brought us any.  Had a feeling like they were under staffed.

The service and the food are amazing at this restaurant. My favorite dish so far are the enchiladas. The karaoke on Saturdays is so much fun with my friends and the appetizers are amazing and easy to share with my friends.

The bean dip was yummy, as were their specialty margaritas. Unfortunately it was super crowded and even though she tried our waitress seemed like she couldn't keep up with all her tables. Maybe they are less busy at other times but I for sure think they should have the needed staff for a busy Friday night.

Leticia's by far is the very best Mexican Restaurant in the valley.  My husband and I have lived here for 16 years with nine being in Green Valley.  This is right in our neighborhood and the entire staff makes you feel like you came to dine with relatives.  The food is not only the best Mexican food but the best home-cooked restaurant in town.  The Cadillac Margarita is awesome!!!! Go, enjoy, you will leave being a happy soul!

I got my hair done right across the street from this place like a week ago. I had dinner at this place tonight and it was better than I expected for a Mexican restaurant. The exterior and interior of this place were very nice. The food was good. The customer service was good as well. The outdoor seating looked very nice as well. I would totally sit outside next time on a nice evening. There was a lot to choose from the menu, I didn't even know what I should have picked. Haha. I ended up gettiny shrimp & crab (more like a shrimp cocktail), I don't remember what it was called. However, pics were posted though.

If you haven't already known, there is a nice little park further down the street from the restaurant, take a little walk and get to know the other person after dinner if you are on a date. This place is in a nice area. Highly recommend!

My husband and I only sit at the bar when we go for Happy Hour. Their appetizers are good, and Liz is the best bartender ever.....she makes a mean margarita and Im picky! Only reason it is 4 stars instead of 5 is their machines are the tightest Ive ever played. I ve never won anything there and neither has anyone else. But Liz is still great.

I've had one of those weeks. I've had a terrible flu, my kids have the flu and I needed a pick me up. I saw they have Posole and I had to have some. We have lived in Vegas for a year and a half and have heard about Leticia's. We live close so it was time. I had my husband pick up the following:
Mexican Corn, Salsa Macha, Pozole, Ribeye tacos ala carte and a boat load of churros for the kids.

For me, this was almost a religious eating experience. My husband feels it is the best Mexican food in the city and we have eaten around. It was one of those meals that makes you rethink every five star rating you've given before- because now you have a different standard to compare it to. Well done. I now must eat my way down the menu. It was worth every penny.
Great food, great customer service, all you need to bring is your self and  company. They will take care the rest.

I ate here last Sunday for lunch and the food is absolutely AMAZING! True, authentic Mexican food. I went with a friend whose husband is 100% Mexican, and is use to his cooking, and she gave it two thumbs up! They greet you at the table with fresh homemade tortilla chips, 2 types of salsa and homemade bean dip. We had the Queso Fundido as an appetizer and it was glorious, cheesy goodness! As for entreés, I had the Quesa Tacos and they were unbelievably delish! I highly recommend Leticia's, and make sure to get the strawberry-jalapeño margarita! Yum!
Loved the food here.  Probably the best mexican food I've had in a long time.

My third time at Leticia's and my third time enjoying the food.  Good number of late lunch customers. I had Birria (beef & goat) for the first time--good choice.  Will try the chicken mole next time.   My friend enjoyed her chicken taco salad. Guacamole could have used a few squeezes of lime.  Our server was Walter--very friendly and upbeat.

AMAZING food. Best Mexican we have had so far in Vegas. In fact we went two days in a row. I judge Mexican food by three things - Margaritas, Sopa De Tortilla and Guacamole. All three were beyond my expectations here. So so good. We were also there for my daughters birthday the other day and she was treated really well and loved the ice cream treat and that everyone sang to her. We will be back lots!!

Wow! It's gone downhill. 

It's just not the same... I order some Carne Asada and Enchilada plate.. After a few bites I was so confused. It was so bland and for some reason the enchilada had a weird powder texture. I unfortunately returned it, the server apologized and had it removedfrom the check but no manager came by?? 

So strange....

They serve authentic mexican food.  This is not a great place for picky eaters.  If your idea of mexican food is Taco Hell and On the Border then stay away from this place.

If you are in a hurry, don't come here.  My visits here have not been "slow" but this is a sit down restaurant and the kitchen takes a little while.  Kitchens are slower when they are making food from scratch - the end result is better food.

I've always had friendly service and last time I was in they were training some nice new people.

Kids menu is very reasonable and there are tons of choices - all of them mexican food.  If your kids will only eat chicken fingers and boxed mac n cheese then I suggest a chain restaurant.  My daughter liked her taquitos, beans, and home made vanilla ice cream.

I'm glad this restaurant opened in our neighborhood.  I wouldn't drive across town just to eat here but it is worth a shorter trip or a visit if you are in the area.

This is one of my favorite places to eat I always get the El pastor burrito and it comes out perfect every time the staff is great and the bartenders do a good job making their drinks how deadly recommend coming to this place you should ask about their habanero salsa

I love Leticia's! I've been several times. It's consistently tasty and fresh. Everything I've tried--from their specialty dishes to normal old tacos--is fantastic. Wait staff is always friendly and attentive.

Leticia's.....My go to "sit down" Mexican restaurant in the NW.  A true dining gem and one..knowing what I know now..would drive from any of the three other points of the valley to visit.

Parking has never been an issue.  That being said depending on when you arrive,  the wait could be an issue.  My advise is be prepared as the inside and outside waiting area's are small.  You could opt for a seat in the bar to wait or dine.  But is you have to wait..where ever that might be..hang in there because it it all worth it.

The inside of LMC is full of character and when you are eventually seated, creates a vibe where you can focus on your family and drown everything else out.

The chips, salsa, and bean dip are divine.  Many a visit I have sabotaged myself.  DON'T DO IT!  It might take you a few visits to learn this and STILL on my most recent visit I failed to heed my own advise.  BALANCE!  Don't spoil the meal with a belly full of this mana.

My personal favorites (so far) are as follows...

The Queso Fundiso, it's fun to say and fun to eat.  Make sure you add the fungus (mushrooms).  It's makes this gooey and cheesy combination with the delicious tortillas POP!

Next up is Leticia's award winning "Quesa Tacos."  This consists of a blend of melted cheeses cooked in a delicious sauce.  You can choose shrimp, chicken or beef, carne asada, or many other meats.  The beef and the shrimp have been my favorites.  You can control the heat of the meal to your liking.  The Pobalano rice is phenomenal!

On my last LMC adventure, I thought I would try something REALLY different.  "El Molcajete" is the prehistoric version of the popular flaming fajitas. Primal but even more delicious, it comes in a smoldering bowl which looks like it was made out of volcanic stone.  A slab of tender carne asada, cheese, ranchero sauce, with shrimp. There was also some greenery hanging off the side which I thought was poblano pepper.  WRONG! After looking at the website, it was a delicious piece of Mexican Cactus.

The Margarita's...............................You will just have to experience them yourself.

The service though one time or two seemed overtaxed.  But the other staff tries hard to fill in making the experience seamless.  When everything IS in sync, no one cane beat it's tasty and friendly efficiency.
Great atmosphere with great people working there.  Very Mexican style to it.  Great food and drinks.  And happy hour to go with it.
This place is the bomb!!!!!! i would recommend any and every person in vegas come and get authentic mexican food.... trust me your taste buds will be in heaven!!!!!

I can assure you that there are much better places to eat Mexican food. I can also assure you that there are places with much better service and real authentic food. It's too pricey for its service and variety. It took them about 45 minutes to bring out the food my family orderd and when they finally did bring the food it turned they didn't have what I had asked for and asked me if I would order something else witch took a another 20 minutes to bring out. The quality of the food was good but this is not authentic Mexican food. (I'm Mexican) If you want 5 star service and real authentic Mexican food go to "The Original Lindo Michoacan." If you don't have a better experience I'll have to bite my own finger off.
Love Leticia's!! I love the soups and street tacos. Delicious margaritas and nice patio seating.
This is my 3rd time here and I can definitely say their food is on point, so delicious and authentic tasting I definitely think if you like Mexican food you need to checkout Leticia's!

As I understand it, Leticia's recipes come from her mother's kitchen in Mexico City.  That definitely explains some of the great tastes found here.

Chips and Salsa start the meal, like almost every Mexican Restaurant here in Las Vegas.  That is not the case in the places I have been in Mexico... but I'm a fan anyways.  And Letecia gives you three dip choices...  A traditional salsa, salsa verde, and bean dip.  All are excellent, though my favorite is the bean dip. 

The entree's are excellent.  They boast a variety of creative tacos that will really get your tasebuds firing.  But I was all about the mole poblano on this trip.  Now I have had some great mole's in Mexico and every one is different from the next.  Here in the states, most places get too caught up on the "chocolate" part.  In reality several Mole's don't even include chocolate and those that rank among the best in Mexico don't emphasize the chocolate.  The sauce has dozens of ingredients.  I was really excited to try Leticia's.  Unfortunately, it came across too chocolate for me.  This will probably appeal to a lot of people... but not me.  Everything else was great and all my party enjoyed their food.  It was all excellent.... but I just didn't care for the mole.

Topping off your meal with fresh Churo's is a nice nod to Mexican street food and truly delicious.

The service was excellent and the restaurant is clean and inviting.  I like Leticia's a lot!  I will be back often for the tacos and enchiladas... but not for the mole poblano.  I am glad to have a great Mexican restaurant in an area that is starving for restaurants.  I hope Leticia's sticks around.  

Give it a try!
I really enjoy their happy hour.  Good drinks and good food what more can you ask for.  Karaoke night is fun and very entertaining lol.
Very good chips when you sit down and order. I had the bacon wrapped shrimp and it was excellent...definitely be back. Nice little neighborhood gathering spot

Every time we visit Vegas from Hawaii, we dine here. The place is the dope for authentic Mexican food. From 3 salsas w your chips to killer everything else. Fish Tacos & Shrimp Fajitas are stand outs! Can't wait to return!!

I don't know how to improve on the food or the service. Everyone seems genuinely happy to be there, staff included. The food is amazing. From the chips and three types of salsa that arrives immediately, to the authentic, home cooked food. 

Even though we've been there 1/2 dozen times, I'm still surprised how good things are. We continue to try different things, but even a simple dish like the quesadilla with carnitas can be a great meal. It's an appetizer, but it's phenomenal. 

We're lucky, we live only a few miles from Leticia's. But I continue to meet people all over Vegas that know the place and drive 20 miles or more to eat there.
I love this place. Best salsas, margarita menu is pretty good, food is delicious, atmosphere has a very authentic Mexican feel. I eat here all the time!
Awesome service and food. I got the mole, and would probably pass on it next time. It was a little too chocolatey and sweet. Mole aside, I can't wait to go back!

We live in the Centennial Hill's area and there are very few family owned restaurants.  Some chains are good but they do not give you the feel of a mom and pop setting.  We recently decided to try Leticia's because it looked so appealing from the outside.  

We were NOT disappointed when we walked in. It is very cute and gives an instant feel of being in a local, family-owned, neighborhood restaurant. We were greeted warmly and were immediately glad we had come in.

We have now been there 3 times in 2 weeks.  We have sat at the bar each time.  The food is fresh and delicious and the carne asada has the most amazing flavors.  It was instantly our favorite!

The staff, including owner Leticia was extremely welcoming.  The bartenders are great!  Ignacia is friendly, very attentive and seems like an old friend when she chats with us.  Wendy is the epitome of friendly and always has a smile while she is giving us her full attention.  Saul is a mixologist.  He has won awards for a few of his drinks and when you taste the strawberry jalepeno margarita you will see why.  He is friendly, professional and knowledgable of the wide variety of tequila's. 

We are going to take friends there next week and cannot wait to show off our new favorite place.  The only downside I can see is that it has become an addictive pleasure for us.  We look forward to going frequently!
Fantastic!! Great food and service. Great bar with lots of drink options. The area has a cool "city" feel for being out in the burbs. Patio is pretty is comfy as well!

Had to get by this place to see what the buzz was truly about. I was not disappointed, from the warm, prompt greeting upon entrance to the restaurant.. next were the fresh chips n salsa/green, tomatillo base salsa and another rojo sauce tasted; fire roasted and beans w a hint of chorizo mixed in for flavor arriving shortly after sitting down and getting situated..wow, were already off to an excellent start.. The flavor of the meat and veggies was really good with the vegetables still having a slightly crisp texture and not mushy as sometimes they can get when not done right.. definitely be back to try more items from the elaborate menu!

How to make Mother's Day and my birthday  less enjoyable?  Go eat at Leticia's Mexican Cocina....wait, we didn't even get to eat.....we walked out. 

The restaurant opens at 10am, our reservation was at 10:30 for the reason that we were a group of 14. I made it a week in advance . We arrived on time to our reservation and were seated promptly. But that's the only good thing they did. After being seated and getting our beverages. It took 30 mins  for the waitress to comeback to take our order. 

We waited, and waited and waited. In the mean time other customers were being seated and eventually served, a few even finished eating. By this time the whole restaurant was full. We kindly asked the bus person, and the waitress about our food. Finally the manager came to our table and told us he was going to check on our food. 

By this time it had been ONE hour and THIRTY mins since our order was taken. The manager came back and kindly said that our food was still not ready. 

He did offer to comp our bill. But that didn't resolve our food not being ready after almost two hours. This is the first time I've walked out of a restaurant. To think that I've praised Leticia's for years makes me even angrier. 

Thank you Leticia's Mexican Cocina.

Excellent service,  great atmosphere,  amazing food!! We used the yelp deal, got a free yummy margarita, and pain $15 for a meal worth much more. Definitely a perfect spot to bring out of town guests, or to have an intimate meal with someone special!

We had heard raving reviews about this place and were excited to check it out. Unfortunately it was nothing special, in fact it was a pretty poor dining experience.

Our wait wasn't that long, though the restaurant was incredibly busy. Our waitress had absolutely no people skills and was clearly in a rush to get through ordering and move on to a new table. She was also seemingly unable to answer any questions about the menu.

We ordered drinks and they were forgotten about until our entrees arrived, which was only minutes after the chips and salsa arrived. This kind of "speedy" service is nothing but rushing a guest through dinner so they can turn over the table faster. This resulted in little time to enjoy the chips, salsa, and guacamole we ordered.

The food was sub-par. The chips didn't taste fresh, the guacamole was covered in cheese (that wasn't specified on the menu) which completely took away from the taste of the avocados. I ordered the enchiladas (one red and one green) and both were tasteless. The sides of rice and beans tasted as if they had been sitting under a lamp for a good hour or so which wouldn't surprise me given how quickly they arrived. I also ordered a house margarita that tasted more like pure sugar than anything else.

Overall, poor service and mediocre food. Based on the rave reviews this establishment had up until the last few months, something has clearly gone wrong at Leticia's.

Good food and jack Daniels margarita but it is really slow at the bar for drinks, card and paying your check. Seems like the bartender needs help since there is only one and they are trying to make drinks and serve food (Tuesday night). I guess not many people gamble here since the bartender had a very hard time making a card. 

Seems like a good place but needs more efficient management and servers. Good people though!

Love this place. The food is fresh and delicious. However, the prices are grievously high and the service, although friendly, is very slow. A pet peeve of mine is waiting to be seated when there are several open tables. I will still go back as the food and drinks are to die for, just fix the wait time and lower your crazy prices please. $15 for a burrito is insane!

I had the tacos of pastor, asada, birria and they were tasty with some good flavor for the area. I have been all over Las Vegas area there are plenty of other place who have some real deal flavorful tacos.  When in the area stop by and it will satisfy the mexican food craving. The customer service was good. There is a big parking lot in the back.

The level of service from this restaurant is excellent. Each time my husband and I dine here we are never let down. The staff, food, and environment is awesome. I highly recommend this place to anyone who enjoys Mexican food. You are seated right away even on busy nights. I am not certain how they do it. I love the location. The Centennial Hills area is very beautiful.

I was with a group of 4 on a Monday night. The place was pretty crowded--which is a good sign. The drinks ordered by my group were apparently quite good. The bean dip was ok, the red salsa was marginal, and the green salsa tasted like grass. I ordered the Tampiquena--made from top sirloin which sounded interesting. When I attempted to order it medium rare, the waiter tried to explain to me that it could not be cooked to order because it was pre-cooked ( I assume he meant marinated) in lime juice, but he assured me that it was very good. I was presented with a very thin, tough and poorly seasoned piece of beef with some cold, clumpy queso on top of it. Not at all impressed. The enchilada that came with it was ok--but certainly nothing special. Judging from the other reviews here, I either came on the wrong night or ordered the wrong thing. If I happen to be this far north in LV again, I might give it another shot.
Ordered a family style asada dish. Had two drinks each. Tres leche desert. Bill was less than $40 a person. Also we got a side of fresh queso. Interesting flavor.

Came on Mothers Day and this place was a disaster. They had reservations pretty much filling in the entire seating area but everyone was running late. They wouldn't seat walk ins that day unless the people with reservations didn't show. One reservation never showed up and they still refused to sit us down after waiting 45 minutes or so. There was only 2 waiters working the whole floor. Every time we come, it seems the staff are running around with their heads cut off and don't know what they're doing..

We were really looking forward to liking this place. We live in the neighborhood and have been meaning to try it out. So tonight I read some Yelp! reviews which sounded promising. The listing said they were open until 10pm. I called Leticia's at 8:30pm to double-check their closing time (this IS Vegas 2011 afterall). "10pm" the lady told me. We arrived at the restaurant at 9:30pm only to find the "closed" sign up and the staff sweeping the floors. I spoke to a lady and reminded her that they had just told me 10pm and she shrugged. So we took our business to nearby Lindo Michoacan who stay open until the hours posted on their sign. We won't be back. What a shame...

The atmosphere was great, great location, and excellent service. The was also GOOD, but the grilled chicken could've used a little more flavor but the overall experience was good.  I would definitely go back, and the server Mario was excellent.

We eat here all the time. My favorites are the pozole (either one), and the empanadas (chicken tinga or beef). The bacon wrapped shrimp & the ribeye are also super good. My favorite desserts are the fried ice cream & the churro. Yum! A little pricier than some Mexican restaurants & although I love the salsa, the chips are just ok. That's why it's a 4 star & not a 5 star.

I had my retirement dinner here.  I was able to reserve Leticia's El Patio.  It was perfect.  I had a little over forty people in attendance.  Andy the manager, worked with me and I was able to get exactly what I wanted. I was able to have my own bar and the waiters and bartender for my event were just wonderful.  The food was great and drinks kept coming.  This by far is my favorite restaurant. I love the atmosphere and the great customer service I always receive.  Thank you for making it so special!

Ok got to start off with the service.  Great personal experience. Our waiter was very helpful. We asked and he got it. No waiting. Second the drinks were great tasting, strong and very smooth. The food. OMG!!!  I ordered the shrimp cocktail. They should call it the endless shrimp cocktail because every spoon full I had shrimp. No need for extra salt nor pepper. It was just right. And the price was very good not to expensive.  Will be raving about this place for a long time.  I've been to a lot of Mexican restaurants and this place has the music and the taste of being in Mexico. Very clean. Also the decor was very cool and just enough lighting for a family dinner or a date night. All around can't go wrong

This place is very different so you have to throw out your typical Mexican expectations.  Once you do that, the food is delish!  Awesome margaritas.  Love the tortilla soup and hubs is a big fan of the build your own burrito.

We had our Christmas party here Friday night.  We paid 26.50 a person for 39 people.  We also charged several other fees that was almost half the cost per person.  

What a HUGE DISAPPOINTMENT!  The food was average at best, but the management was rude and unaccommodating.  We still had 6 people who had not gotten up to get a plate of food.  We didn't have enough food, and requested some more food.  We were told we needed to order off the menu and pay for it separately.  This is AFTER paying for the buffet for all 39 people. 

When you bring almost 40 people to your place of business, that's not how you treat them.  Go somewhere else for you parties, you will be sorry if you go here!

Omg!!! We love Leticias!!! The food is always amazing our favorite is chicken enchiladas with green sauce and the white rice casserole!!! Service is phenomenal we are always treated like family, shot out to Lisa, she is the best  and the guy who brings chips and salsa he remembers us every time and brings my baby girl her own little bean dip we love this place

Quesatacos! Wow! So impressed from the chips to the meal, all around amazing meal. I tried the chicken (shredded) and carne asada. Can't decide which I liked better. Spicy rice casserole was delicious too!

This is the second time here within a month.  We were referred by a friend in the area.  We sometimes travel to have good eats!  This restaurant is in a cozy area that kind of resembles the beginnings of an Old Pasadena.  It was busy just like the last time.  There were a lot of staff.  Everyone of them, friendly.  Particularly Dulce and Walter.  We had five in the party, so we had a lot to order.  The food arrived promptly, was very tasty and eye pleasing like last time.  Check out my photos.  The atmosphere was lively and the restrooms clean and in order.  When I checked into Yelp there was an offer to purchase a coupon that would save $10.  I purchased it on my cell phone and Dulce redeemed it for this receipt all within 5 minutes!  Also what was cool is that the owner came around and talked to us and other patrons throughout our dinner experience.  
  We will definitely be back for more and tell a lot of friends!!

Worst Mexican food I've ever had in my life. Extremely OVER PRICED! I like greasy Mexican food, but here it tasted like they poured 5 cups of grease on top of every dish before taking it to the table. On top of all that the service was TERRIBLE! Our server payed attention to all other tables but ours. Took forever to get one simple refill. Idk if he treated us bad because we're a young couple and thought we'd tip bad or what, but that shouldn't matter! You should give EVERYONE AMAZING SERVICE, not just the tables who look rich. Yes I will tell people about this place. But I'll be telling them how bad of an experience I had, and how disgusting the food was!!

Tyler was an awesome considerate and super friendly server. When the busser came to the table he was unaware of what the salsa was called that he was serving but was very rude about it. It was like he was upset at us because he didn't speak English. His name was Rosalto. We asked him for To-go boxes and he became annoyed because we asked for one that the taquitos fit in as he brought us a bowl for them. We asked for a cup for my moms tea and he rudely said "you can't put your margarita in there" we said it's for our tea. When he came back he physically reached over the table to grab the cup out of my moms hand, then all a sudden he spoke English.
