We said it's tea, he then walked away and started muttering words to other servers about us and then stared me down as we walked out the door. If, if I went there again I'd demand another server besides him. He's very bad for your business.

Food is great!  Decor is eclectic and a little more upscale.  The salad has mixed greens rather than iceberg lettuce.  Portion sizes are good.  The chips and salsa taste fresh and the bean dip they serve with it is so yummy!  If I go by myself, the service can be spotty.  I like to eat out alone and I feel like I'm sort of a last priority at times, especially when it's busy.  When I'm with other people, the service seems much better.  They offer military discounts, which is a nice bonus!  :-)

My friends and I had breakfast at Leticia's, and we were very satisfied with the food and customer service. From the moment we walked in, the hostess greeted us and quickly took us to our table. Three salsas and chips were served as complimentary appetizer. The quality and taste of the salsa said a lot about the expectation of the entrées. My friend and I ordered menudo, it wasn't the best I've tasted but it was a hood portion. My girlfriend ordered a wet green burrito, and loved it. Our server was extremely professional and friendly, and so was the rest of the staff. I will definitely be back. :)

This place is a drive for us ,but was well worth it. Leticia's is almost like mexican fine dining w/o the big prices . Plates are beautiful.
           I knew when the chips and salsa came we were in for a treat. 
The chip are a little thicker and  served warm with two salsas one red and the other tomatillo and beans. Heck the refried beans were tasty.  
        I ordered  a small guacamole , it had a little cheese stick on top as a garnish and sprinkled with cojita cheese. It was impressive to look at and tasted even better .
           i got the combo plate with carnitas burrito and chile rellano stuffed with steak picado i think thats how u spell it. The chile came with a red sauce and drizziled with sour cream , it was very good. The carnitas burrito was a little dry, jus carnitas and tortilla nothing else in it. Maybe i should have gotten it enchilada style , maybe my fault. The plating again was beautiful, the rice and beans tasty and fresh. I think i saw chef leticia's in the kitchen she looked busy ,if she was not i would have complimented her food , bravo.
Was an alright restaurant, I would return here again, slightly overpriced though. The food quality was good though!
Lively atmosphere & killer pozolè & it's available all the time...... Score. Love the devote & very friendly staff. The margaritas looked really good but I had a michelada & it was delish!

Not sure whose idea it was to serve mole poblano in a full cup of stale oil, but I haven't had food this disgusting in years.  Corn tortillas were fine.  Chips were good enough.  Rice and beans weren't bad.  But holy smokes, the pork in the mole poblano was drowning in oil.  It's like they bought one of those cheap bottles of mole mix from Wal-mart, then dumped the top half of the bottle in without mixing the oil and mole back together.  

My wife said the shrimp taquesos were good, so I might go back and order those.  But yuck, yuck, yuck!  Don't get the mole.
Amazing food, ambiance and fabulous service... worth every penny!! Our new fav! We will be dining here often.
Excellent food and service! Gotta try this place out ASAP!!!!! You won't be disappointed! :) Claudiu is an amazing server.

We visited this place for the first time on 5/13 and noticed that we were charged misc fees.  I ordered a jalapeno strawberry margarita which was listed for $8 on the menu.  The check said jalapeno margarita $8 + $1 for strawberry.  Not sure why i was charged the extra dollar.  I also ordered the fish tacos which were $13 on the menu the check showed $13 + $1 for Fish. excuse me? you charged me a dollar for fish when i ordered fish tacos?? lastly the fish tacos came with ONE wedge (for 2 large tacos) of lime which had not one drop of juice so i showed the waiter the lemon was dry and asked him for a replacement.  He took so long my tacos got cold and i ended up using the lime from my margarita cup instead.  He finally showed and apologized for the long wait.  I noticed on my bill i was charged $0.75 for lime :-/ Not cool.  The food was pretty good and the place is close to our house but we will not be returning. Makes me wonder how many suckers (like us) are paying the misc fees without even noticing.  I doubt we will be returning.  CHECK YOUR BILL EVERYONE!!!!!
nothing bad to say about this place. easily one of the best Mexican restaurants in town. the cocktail drinks are amazing and the prices are reasonable.

Frequent diners with little complaints however our last visit was the worst.  Our sever was more focused on pleasing a group of "family/relatives" to the owner then she was on her other tables.  We had to remind her several times to bring us a drink & that we were ready to order.

We eat Mexican food all the time. When we travel from Summerlin to eat here all the time believe when I say this is outstanding Mexican Food! I can't survive without my weekly fix of puffy tacos. The service is excellent and the atmosphere is worth the drive!

The food here is okay, but nothing special. The food tastes okay, but it is expensive for what you get. My favorite part was the chips with salsa and bean dip, which are ironically free when you find in.
Decent food. Not great service. Very expensive. Look to spend at least $120 for 4 people. Also always seem to be out of a lot of items.

Good neighborhood Mexican food, great margaritas, and mostly very good service. Always busy so we try and hit it around 5 pm. I've tasted their tacos, enchiladas, chicken mole, and various other things which were all great. It's weird, but their hamburger is among the best I've ever had.

The first time I tried Leticia's, I wasn't feeling it. Then some friends were in town, and we went back based on Yelp reviews. I am happy I gave this place a second shot. The street tacos are absolutely delicious and a great price. The table salsa is a little spicy for this gringa, but I make the sacrifice. :) Service is average. For some reason, there never seems to be a hostess when we go and we wait a while to get seated. There is a nice but small outdoor patio to enjoy the nicer weather. It was also a bonus to find out it is a woman-owned business.
I love me Mexican food! And being Latina and finding great traditional Mexican food is very hard. This place has won my heart with Mexican food! Delicioso !!

Good, main course excellent.  However the tortillas are dry, the beans and rice are wrong, definitely not alta california origin.  However i will go back again because it is still the best in Las Vegas.

Came here because of the good reviews... Was not impressed. The food was okay... The service was okay... The location is nice. Will I be back anytime soon? No. I'll probably just stick with authentic places on the east side of town...

This place is the bees knees! We live not too far away, and coming home from work had alway seen it packed to hilt, so we finally decide to try it out. The verdict? Awesome.  And we've been back a couple times now, with each time as good as the last.

We've been in for breakfast and dinner and have tried a number of the offerings here, and everything is amazing.  I've not had a single dish I've not liked. The quesadillas and guacamole are amazing.  We've done the build your own burritos and enchiladas a few times (both carinatas and carne asada) which were also great.  I've also had an amazing breakfast burrito and the best machaca ever at this spot.  Just great food.  Really good margaritas as well. 

Service is always fast, friendly, and efficient. And the food is a good value with huge portions (easily two meals unless you're a REALLY big eater).  I just can't say enough good things about this place.  Try it!  You'll like it!

Went there the first week of May of 2016 and it seemed to me like all of their employees were new. My fiancée and I was asked what we would like to drink three separate times. We only wanted a Pepsi and a water. Not a hard task. We finally got our drinks around 30 minutes later. The table next to us ordered guacamole chip dip. And I overheard the customer say it was also 30 minutes! For chip dip!? We finally got our food. And that was great! My recommendation is to go to the bar and eat there. The service was excellent the last time I sat at the bar.

We were greeted warmly upon entering, good start.  Seated, then waited about 20 minutes until someone asked if we'd seen a waiter, thumbs down on that one.  I ordered a house Margarita on the rocks which tasted mostly of Margarita mix (no hint of alcohol) and was about 90% ice.  Won't do that again.  We shared the Family Style for Two chicken enchiladas, which came with a variety of sauces for our pleasure, all this was quite good.  Then my wife found a small bone in her chicken, not good.  And the menu has very little to choose from, something rare to see these days.  
     So we'd go back again (if we had a coupon) only because there were some enjoyable parts to the visit, but too many negatives for us to make it a regular haunt.

We go here all the time, love the food. Last night, we waited over 30 minutes for a table. There were over 10 empty tables but supposedly you did not have enough servers. Really, you have good business, buck up and hire more staff. The table we ended up sitting at had been empty and cleaned for 25 minutes.
Excellent service!!! They were on top of our needs... Beautiful interior of restaurant..  Chips and the 3 salsas are great ...  Will come back
Employees don't always come off as friendly. The bar staff is very arrogant. The seafood enchiladas are amazing but a little pricy.

We came at the busier lunch time I've seen and the staff still had everything well running! We were seen right away and seated. Our drink orders arrived promptly. This is the best Mexican food I've found out here... Which is rare for me to say since I'm from Texas. The guacamole was sooooo fresh. And the Mexican corn on the cob was fantastic, they will even cut it off the cob if you ask. And don't even get me started on the yummy chips and dips! He and I didn't have enough room left for desert but I know they smelled amazing.
Cute little authentic Mexican restaurant. Love the empanadas.
Really a great place service is great. Street corn too pricey but really good overall best in the area

I wish I could give it 0 stars. This is the worst food I've ever had in my life. I'm the type of person who will eat anything handed to them, I'm definitely not picky, but this place is trash along with their customer service. Half of the good reviews on here must be fake, don't come here. Save yourself.

Food was only so-so. The dip they give you is really good! Our waiter got the drink order wrong three times, and it was a simple margarita. It also took a very long time to get service and our food and they weren't that busy. I'd go back but it wouldn't be my first choice, it's close to the house so only out of convenience.
Will go back . Great service, great food. Burrito are huge and super fresh ingredients

Had lunch here today. First let me start by saying the food is great. The salsa brought with chips when you are seated ( and you server acknowledges your existence) its so delicious it makes it a little hard to write this review. We had to ask the busser to take our drink order, then about 10 mins later we had to ask him to have someone come take out order. With a 3 yr old and 1 yr old in our party it was getting ridiculous. Our busser (great young guy) hurried around the restaurant doing as much as he could for several tables I saw the servers standing off to the side talking. As we waited for our food another patron was up front complaining she had only seen her server once and was NOT happy about her service. One of our water cups was dirty and when the guy came around to refill it was with carbonated water and had to give us all new water (no biggie) the food FINALLY came and the kids were beyond starving (took about 30 mins) I could understand if the place was busy but there were 4/5 tables max... The food was a little cold but tasted great. The place is clean and the decor is very nice. The music and the salsa were my favorite part. We left a nice tip (for the busser) it's sad to think this kid worked as hard as he did for a woman whom we interacted with twice to get the tip.. I'm not sure the salsa is enough to bring us back. Staff really needs to get it together even on a slow day. People that were seated after us had their order taken before us and we had to ASK to helped.

I wanted so bad like another review said to love this place. We drove from Lone Mtn & 5th which is not close.
From the outside my Man was like are you serious this place is gonna have canned beans (bcz looks like a americanized unauthentic place w/ 99% non-authentic people going in & out)I'm like the reviews say the owner cooks & it's really a family run spot. 
Going inside its decorated how my dream kitchen is (style wise).
We were seated in "Lucian's " section. He seems bothered by all of the customers demands & months of unfamiliarity with "mexican" food.
I ask what he recommends he points out three of the highest priced plates. I choose the "Quesa Tacos" - I get something saucy w meat inside two cold unfresh corn tortillas - the beans were Eh (maybe canned!)The rice was white rice w green chiles & hot sour cream or something creamy (I dunno)
Kids meal had cold limp fries that maybe were fresh cut in house at one point- not tonight- the chicken fingers appeared hand made.
My man had a wet burrito it was a good size for 13.00
Chips weren't warm like another review said they would be-they had a cold styrofoam texture & salsa being chipotle not my thing but tasted cool.
was 55.00 for 2+kid
Tacos & burrito... Burnt out server
Rest of staff was nice.
BOTTOM LINE: Mar Y Tierra = Authentic non-Americanized w the best salsa & chips & Coctel de Cameron & carne Asada !!! For 35-40$ there we would Eat like Kings(& Reynas)!!

Sooooo good! The friendliest service and homemade and delicious food. The owner is always out and about visiting with the customers. You can't go without having the Mexican corn on the cob. I don't know how he does it, but any time of year, they serve the most tender white corn with all the delicious street-vendor white sauce and cheese. I sometimes order two of these and soup - they make delish albondigas soup. Great chips and salsa, free of course. Wonderful fajitas and sopapillas too!

Wow, this restaurant has the worst customer service! Came in for lunch around 11:30 and the restaurant was pretty empty. We were a party of two and The "host" told us it would be a minute or so, then another party of two comes in and he goes to seat them right away... It wasn't until I spoke up that he then sat us first. Then to make a really long bad experience short, we waited over an hour for appetizers and then was overcharged! When I pointed it out to the "waitress/bartender" she first tried saying its because I got a filling in my taquitos! Really? Because the menu states choice of filling for $6.89, she then said its a glitch in the register system! Whatever, I'll stick with Viva Mercados!
Great tacos and soup love the service from waitress iseli and another woman that was dressed like manager not sure but both were great thank you leticias !!!

I met a girlfriend for a 'let's catch up lunch" and was lucky that we both agreed on this place.  Service was friendly. It took us a little bit to order because we were chatting and I was getting my son situated and the waitress kept coming over to check on us to see if we were ready to order. A little more time in between would have been better. A good waiter(ess) should be able to judge their table and know how often is too much.

We started with guacamole and it was alright. My girlfriend had raved on and on about it so when we got it, she wasn't that far off.

I went with a chicken finger meal for my son. The chicken fingers were made fresh with their own batter. They came out hot, fresh and crispy with plenty of french fries.

I went with a fish taco and rice. There was plenty of fish on my tacos and they were super delish and yummy. I was really surprised by how much I loved them. 

My girlfriend ordered a chimichanga which she shared and boy oh boy, was that sucker huge. It was filled with lots of meat and cheese. 

Overall, I had a good experience and definitely need to make my way back soon.

Perfect little spot. I wish I lived closer.

So so good! We were wandering through the Centennial area and found this awesome restaurant near the freeway exit. We didn't know what to get but our server Rigelio was very very helpful. We got the enchiladas and that you build your own burrito. The cream sauce and the Tinga chicken burrito was delish! I also got the burrito half mole and half cheese cream sauce, enchilada style which was good so I could try two sauces. I live in central Las Vegas but believe me I will be back with more people to try this place :)

wow...WOW...W O W!!

this place is fantastic! i was impressed with this mexican food place. the horchata is divine!!! (no rice water powder here) I had a carne asada burrito and that was spectacular, and my husband had the red posole and i couldn't stop eating from his bowl. FIVE stars well deserved. the waiters were very nice too!! its about 12 miles from the strip but if you want some great authentic mexican food come here!

I was there with a group and everyone said their food was excellent.  One in our party has been to Leticia's a lot, so she obviously has had a track record of good experiences - enough to bring a group of 8 there.

I will vouch for the deliciousness of the Pozole Blanco.  I loved all the fresh veggies that you can add in proportions to your own liking.  I also learned (from having leftovers - the portion sizes were generous...  I had leftover soup from ordering a small) that the avocado in the soup (this soup, at least) was still bright green the second day when I reheated it for lunch as it was the first day.  Cool!

I live down in the Anthem area and can't think of any Mexican restaurant that quite met up to what I saw or experienced this day.  Although I do love Las Cazuelas - gave them 5 stars, too - but their menu is pretty tiny compared with Leticia's although it has the mom and pop atmosphere.  That's really the only possible complaint about Leticia's - its success means they're no longer a mom and pop place - not bad, just not as personal as it undoubtedly was when it first started.  Anyway, I will be looking for a reason to be in Centennial so I can go back sometime.

I think my father summed it up well, he's never before left a Mexican joint not full of beans and rice. It was weird how there was so little of each and the rice had cold clumps. I got the impression we got leftover rice reheated. I'm not a temperature freak either, but sorry, it was cold.

I find it bizarre that this place has so many peachy reviews on other sites. Taco Bell definitely has nothing to worry about.

This place has amazing food, but the service gets worse and worse every time we visit. It seems like they have tried fixing it in recent visits, because there is someone to take drink orders and someone to take food. Hopefully it gets better because it's such good food.

Won't be back, been here a few times and keeps getting worse. Went for lunch today, waiter forget our tortillas with meal. Also asked what kind of meat I want, but they only put cheese ...duh... One entree, the menu description said comes with CILANTRO RICE, but they served with Spanish rice, and we asked about it they said we were wrong and CHARGED US FOR A SIDE OF CILANTRO RICS. We checked the menu on way out to be sure were didn't miss read it, but it did say CILANTRO rice. Instead of arguing we decided it WOULD BE OUR LAST TIME !!!! NEVER AGAIN WILL WE GO THERE.
The BEST Mexican food in Vegas, Chili Verde Amazing!!! the best I ever had....
I can't speak on their whole menu, but my husband & I always order half a dozen tamales to share & they are AMAZING (& filling). Letitia's also offers Military discount, so that's a plus!

This place was so great the first 2 years it opened but the only thing we go there for now is the queso fundido. And that has been inconsistent lately. Went tonight and WOW the prices have gone up!! I ordered a Taco salad and a margarita. We just missed happy hour and the $9 house margarita was weak and watery. A lackluster start....I ordered a taco salad with ground beef (like a taco) and my husband had the queso fundido with chorizo which was good this time. When the bill came, my taco salad was $10 with ground beef $3 more?? so my husband nicely asked "why the up charge on the taco salad?" The server told us "Oh it's $10 for a vegetarian taco salad, the taco beef is $3 extra" 
LMAO! Really??! 
Isn't a "vegetarian taco salad" just a SALAD?
Now, I am happy to pay the price for good food but don't like getting "nickle & dimed" on dining out. Also, if you don't order a full meal or a bar beverage the complimentary chips and salsa are $4.50! Sorry Leticia, Michoacan is way better.

It pains me to give Leticia's such a low review because the food is incredible. However the service may not be the best - pretty hit and miss depending on whom you get.

Today, however, closed the deal for me not to give this restaurant my business. We wanted to celebrate a going away party so I called for a reservation for 10. The hostess was ok but from the get go gave me the impression that she was not happy with reserving for a party that size. After putting me on hold and asking the manager she told me that they would have to have a $150 deposit which would be not refunded if I do not cancel at least 2 hours earlier or if at least 75% of my party doesn't show up. That would mean that if 2 people cancel last minute, not only they would get the revenue of 7 people, but they would get an extra $150. Since when are local restaurants turning into airlines??

Regardless I said ok here is my Amex and exp, but then they wanted my security code. Say what??? For a reservation guarantee?

I told them that if they are adamant about getting my code I will take my business elsewhere and their answer was ok, I am sorry.

Too bad, the food was good.

The lunch bill was reasonable. There was a choice of five or so meats and 6 sauces for the enchilada dish i got. The mole was excellent and perfectly cooked. The beans had cochita cheese like i like. The chips had three sauces to dip red, green and bean dip and all were excellent. Some of our party raved about the soup but i didnt try it. For really reasonable mexican quizine that is tasty this place is good. And childrens menu helps.

I live in summerlin so this place is a little out of the way but way worth the trip. The pablano stuffed with shrimp is so damn good! I wanted to take a whole other one home to eat later.  The salsa's here are authentic and have just the right kick.  Gustavo is an absolute gentleman and makes you feel like you are eating at his home.

I've been in Las Vegas since 2009 and this restaurant is by far the best Mexican food I've eaten here. 

The best part is they are always pretty busy but I've never waited more than 10mins for a table. 

I've had a lot of there meals/combos. But I think they have the best Carne Asada. Tonight I had the Nacho fries with the carne Asada. Very full feeling. Didn't even eat them all.


So all the good things said
The service has declined and we only saw our waiter 3 times. Once to take our order. Second time to drop off food. Third was our check. The little bus boy had to stop him to refill my drink. This manager lady walked by twice and never offered to refill my empty glass. There used to be a guy named Gus. He made you smile and always told you what was best to order. 
This is a good place to eat. But this is definitely not a Texas style Mexican cantina. Still on the search for a New Mexican restaurant i can call home.

Should I go back.........yes no maybe
It will be awhile maybe a few months or so.

For starters the service was great but slow. Waitress was very friendly and the executive chef discounted our overall bill because we waited over 45 minutes for our lunch entrées.  The pop and lemonade tasted dirty. I sent back a total of three drinks and stuck with water. The chips and salsa were decent. I ordered beef and chicken fajitas. Beef tasted like teriyaki and the chicken was dry. Didn't really enjoy the overall taste of the beef and chicken combo. Most likely won't be going back.

It doesn't hurt that it's a mile from our home (actually that's probably a good thing considering the margarita situation), but Leticia's is one of those local gems of LV. Everything we've had here is excellent. Be careful with the spice... It can creep up on you. BUT. It's obvious from the mouthfeel of the spicy food that they use extremely fresh ingredients (habanero, green chilis, etc).
Maury is our favorite bartender (we normally go in the middle of the week). If you're going in the evening, plan to get there early as there is usually a wait.

Another great find thanks to Yelp. A cute little place with an outdoor patio. We got seated quickly and they had a fairly extensive menu so it was hard to choose. We were here for lunch but it was late so we missed the lunch specials. There were four of us and we had a custom built breakfast burrito, two taco salads (one without the shell) and one seafood soup. The food was hot, prompt, huge and yummy. We were all super happy. Our waiter was fabulous and kept our drinks filled. The free chips, salsa and bean dip were great. We would definitely come back!
Yum!!  Best Mexican food in town.  I love the different enchilada sauces and the Macha appetizer!
Amazingly fresh food and great customer service! We invited a new dessert tonight, a sopapilla with fried ice cream inside, it's called the Brett, ask Joanne!

Went in to order takeout, they were busy and took forever with my order. When I got home they had given me menudo instead of the Pozole I ordered. So I basically drove 20 minutes, waited forever, got home and was given the wrong thing. I absolutely hate menudo. So that was a huge waste of time and money.
Great service and good food. Drinks are made strong, worth the money. Fluffy cheesecake is the best!!!

Food was good...nothing to rave about but enjoyable nonetheless.  The booth we were seated in was darker than normal....even if it was for "mood" lighting.  Our biggest disappointment was the mediocre service....almost snail-like for a relatively empty establishment.  On the plus side, the chips and salsa was good.
R&J

This place is pretty excellent. They have big portions and you can pretty much share with whoever you're with because it's that big. They have excellent customer service. Only reason why I put four stars is because it's kind of expensive. My boyfriend and I don't really order any appetizers or desserts or anything like that, but we still on average spend at least fifty bucks.

It's okay though, because we only go here once in a while and the good is good.

I don't have enough positive words to say about Leticia's!  Simply the BEST Mexican food in Las Vegas and beyond.  We like to call it "Mexican gourmet," but there's a comfort level that goes beyond gourmet.  From the time you walk in, until the time you leave, you're treated like family.  You'll see regulars, tourists, and celebrities (Carlos Santana eats here!!!!), all treated the same by the lovely Leticia.  

Fair warning, the free salsa/beans and chips are HIGHLY addictive!  I can't even count the number of times that we've had to take home the majority of our entrée because we filled up on the margaritas and chips & salsa.  I would seriously hurt someone to get her tomatillo salsa recipe.  Seriously.  You can have my firstborn.  

Don't be afraid to ask your server for recommendations.  Or the person at the next table, if their food looks interesting.

Leticias is simply THE BEST Mexican Restaurant in Las Vegas! Previously a big fan of the Michoacan Mexican Restaurants, Leticias raises the bar 10x. Our waiter told us that the owners of Michoacan eat there! You can't go Wrong eating here!!!!

Have been here several times and it has never disappointed. First off, the service is amazing. Every employee here has been extremely nice, professional and knowledgeable about the menu. Second, food has always been great no matter what I get and you get three dips along with the obligatory chips before the meal. Third, they have great happy hour specials. You can't go wrong here!

My search for the best Mexican food in Las Vegas is over!  Friends introduced us to Leticia's last Saturday and we will be forever grateful to them.  The menu is amazing with a nice balance of traditional and contemporary dishes.  The chips are fresh and very tasty and they are accompanied by a couple of different salsas and a warm bean dip giving everyone something to enjoy.  The house Magurita was reasonably priced and enjoyable to taste.  For my entre' I ordered the beef enchiladas and I thoroughly enjoyed them!  If you order a combo, be sure to ask for the white rice instead of the traditional Mexican rice with tomato sauce.  I have never had anything like it in my life.  It is delicious! Our server was attentive and made sure we were happy throughout our dining experience.  I plan on visiting often.  Leticia's is a treasure!!

My husband and I just moved here from AZ and we just love, love this place.  The service is always as wonderful as the food is.  
The owner is the wonderful lady in the kitchen cooking the food.
Yum,yum!!!  I have to say we have only been here a month and have almost been here for lunch or dinner about 20 times. Yes it's that good.

I know I'm in the minority here, but this place just wasn't that good.  The service was slow, the food was sub par and there really isn't a reason for me to go back.

I went here with some family and tired a few different things on the menu and wasn't impressed.  The tamales were bland, the tacos were cold and the salad not impressive.  

In a city with lots of good Mexican food, I see no reason to eat here.

Best Mexican food in Las Vegas. Love, love, love their enchiladas with green sauce.

Only complaint is I have to wait in line on weekends and I am too much of a diva for that.

Leticia's is the best!!
Very authentic Mexican food.  Our favorite Mexican restaurant in the Vegas area by far.  Good margaritas!!!  We try to take our guests there at least once during their visit.

I was really excited to live so close to a Mexican restaurant when we moved to the area, and our first dinner here was great; service and food. However every time since has been disappointing. I have tried a variety of menu items hoping to find something worth coming back to but its just "okay". The staff is all over the place running around, one night a waiter ran around the corner booth and kicked an empty chair in his rush and it flew right into my fathers leg, it was hard enough that my father said "ouch". He made eye contact with our table grabbed the chair from the floor and walked away without even acknowledging the fact he hit a customer. I know he was aware of it because he went and told the manager about the incident right in front of the kitchen window, we were seated two booths over so we were able to see & hear the conversation happen. Not the waiter or manager came over to make sure he was okay or apologize for the incident. We let the incident go and even returned tonight giving it a last chance. My husbands dinner was not as he ordered it and his said his margarita was terrible, unfortunately we will not be returning.
Sometimes when I'm craving that mexican food. I'll go here. Few places can beat them. They are a hidden gem

The staff has always been on point every time I dine here and has always provided the best service. The food brings back memories for me from when I used to go to a particular restaurant in long beach California when I was a kid and it's nice to know that now I have somewhere in Vegas that has the same type of great atmosphere and amazing food. The fried ice cream is the best I've ever had so far definitely recommend Leticia's for anyone that wants some quality Mexican food. :)

So sad. Came to Leticia's, our go-to Mexican restaurant. The food wasn't nearly as good as it was the past few times we've come and the service was lack-luster. Asked the waitress for extra sauce for my wet burrito, because it was pretty dry when it came to the table. Apparently, the waitress forgot because we never got the extra sauce. And to top it all off, our glasses went empty a couple of times and we had to request refills. Disappointing, to say the least:(
Food was amazing. Justin at the bar, was incredible!  Great suggestions for entrees and drinks!

Came back because we had such great service the first time. We got seated right away but it took like 10 minutes before we got service and that's because we mentioned something to the bartender. We spent about 45.00 for 2 people. Kind of high to me. Rice was mushy. Next time I will go across the way to Michoan

What can I say?  I love everything about this place.  We travel 20 miles to get here, passing several Mexican restaurants on the way.  The service has always been good, with chips/salsas arriving at our table when we sit.  Our water glasses never have a chance to get empty.  I have tried the chili relleno... a nice sized Anaheim chili filled with what looks to be jack cheese.  Very tasty.  The seafood enchiladas are to die for.  They are smothered in a sauce that makes you want to lick the plate.  Friends have had fajitas and like the fresh vegetables.  Food is always very fresh tasting and has so much flavor.   Prices are very reasonable.  Mixed drinks are good; a great margarita!  The staff is very attentive and friendly.  Don't miss Leticia's.  It is worth the drive.

I have been coming to Leticia's on a consistent basis since they opened. I have always enjoyed the food and consider this to be one of the best Mexican restaurants in the valley. 

The food remains good, however I have been noticing a steady decline in the service. Good establishments get busy and Leticia's is no exception. Today we came in for lunch, took a while before anyone came and got our drink order. The waitress was confused on the fish tacos when we said we wanted grilled, she said "okay so soft" as if she was referencing the tortillas. On top of that I never received any drink refills, despite the wait staff telling me they would bring a refill. The service is really disappointing and I hope that it turns around because I really enjoy the food.

Chips and salsa were great

I got 2 cheese enchiladas one red and one with ranchera sauce when it came out I had one green instead of red but they caught it before they brought it out and brought a third red a few minutes later.  The ranchera was great went with the cheese perfectly.  The green would have been better with chicken or fish.  Tons of food didn't even eat the third but the red sauce is tasty.  Left overs are great.  Will be back sometime.

I hate doing this, but I feel it needs to be said. 

Firstly, I love Leticia's. By love, I mean we eat here a lot. By a lot, I mean we frequent this place at least once a month. That's a lot for me. 

The reason for this update is the service. We sit at the bar because we like to play for free drinks. And it's usually just my boyfriend and I. Otherwise, we'll sit at a table. And I have almost always had a bad experience when we're seated. The waiters/waitresses seem so rushed, so annoyed and just generally pretty rude. I hate being biased and I have been for way too long. They are seriously lacking on how to treat clients. They rarely check on you, take forever to get you food or drinks. If I'm here with a smaller or larger party,  it's made no difference. Each time, we have been waiting too long or just had a server that doesn't seem too keen about helping us. 

The bartenders are awesome. They have a few new ones that have been excellent. The food each time has come out perfectly and delicious as always. The main reason we come to this place. 
Now, I hate referring people here. Each time, they say the same thing. They loved the food but hated the service. 

So, I give you 3 stars - for the servers, please...do not ruin such a great place. For the food, drinks and bartenders - I give you 5 stars.

Heard about this place through a friend. Just moved from Texas where mom and pop Mexican restaurants are dime a dozen and all are amazing. 

Well this place did not disappoint. Went on a Tuesday where the margaritas are priced 2 for 1 at 7.50. Honestly the most equally balanced margaritas I have had. Then had the make your own burrito and you honestly don't want to stop eating.

We will be a regular here that is for sure. I would recommend this place to all my friends.

This was always our favorite Mexican restaurant until last night. We were seated right away which was great, usually we have to wait, we ordered drinks one person in our party requested light on the tequila and the waiters response was "don't worry about it the ice will melt and dilute it".  Now for the meal, we ordered our food and it took about 45 minutes before it arrived on our table. All 4 meals were cold like they were sitting out for a while. We told the waiter and he did not even try to rectify the situation, in addition to the cold meals my plate was chipped in 2 corners. The manager never came over to the table. The waiter took our plates and gave us a bill for our drinks. This place has really gone down hill, will we come back? Probably not.

I've heard some excellent things about Leticia's, and I finally went to try it out myself. It's a drive that's for sure, so prepare for a roadtrip. The place itself and the area where the restaurant is located are both very cute. It's not a huge place, but the decor is really nice. The bar area does have gaming, and there is a separate restaurant side as well.

We sat down and were immediately brought water, chips, and 3 dip options: bean dip, a smoky mild salsa, and a very cilantro-y smooth guacamole. All were very good, and the chips were fresh. Our server Saul came to take our beverage order (2 Dos Equis), and then disappeared for at least ten minutes, if not 15. When he came back, he had no beer, ran to the bar, came back and said they were out of Dos Equis.... Not okay with that delay, or paying for the Pacifico that I didn't really want. Anyway, the service got a little better from here on out, except that when my mother ordered her chicken enchiladas, he tried to push a different style chicken on her, which was very awkward. I kind of interjected and said no, she's good... Very strange interaction. 

I consider myself quite the connoisseur of cheese enchiladas, so of course this is what I ordered. They were very good, not the best I've had, but very good. The beans and rice that came with the enchiladas were great, extremely flavorful. My mom loved her shredded chicken enchiladas, and my dad loved his steak fajitas.

Loved the decor/restaurant itself, liked the food, and was unimpressed with the service.

Horrible food and service! It took over an hour to get our food and it was not even busy. On top of that, our waitress seemed bothered by having to serve us. 

I ordered the Asada and chicken enchiladas, which were far too salty. My dad ordered the birria, which he also thought was too salty and greasy. I would not recommend this place.

Wow! This place is SO good! We came here for lunch, desiring something different. We are MORE than pleased. Every salsa is authentic and delicious and the entrees are reasonably priced and tasty tasty! We will definitely be back. So happy with the food and service.

Love their ambiance and exterior look especially at night. However, the 5x I've been here...the first time was the best time. And down the slide we go.

The remainder of times...service sucked! I don't really use such word often, but felt fitting to do so. Our guy disappeared. Actually, we had the same server 3x! What luck! Each time he disappeared. I felt like our table had that "run forest run" sign they have at Bubba Gumps if you don't need your server. I reenacted in my head the part where I flip.over to the side of the sign that tells your waiter to stop because you need them. The service was special for sure.

My husband has ordered their pozole a few times over and seems to be salty each time he has ordered it. He works nearby and sometimes he comes in there because vendors or board members would like to eat there as a informal lunch meeting so he has more dine-in experience. He has felt they have gone downhill. He doesn't feel the price ratio to food quality match and have been inconsistent. I have to agree because their taco salad was pretty skim considering it starts at 10 bucks then whatever extra it costs to add meat. 

5 stars for the corn because I never had mexican street corn until here and I have yet to find a spot that can beat that euphoria I felt upon taking my first bite. Corn wasn't overcooked at all! 

Overall, it's just a 3 star spot for me. I was really excited the first time.in hopes of finding a good sit down mexican restaurant...but unfortunately, Leticias isn't it for us at least. There's nothing extra special aside from.it being the only decent restaurant within the Tule Springs vicinity. Nothing to drive across town for.

They do get busy in there, though, but I have been able to bring a stroller in there without inconvenience and no broken buckle high chairs!

I just adorable this place. Hands down one of the best places for their rib eye tacos. I usually get al a carte cooked to your liking it's delicious and you could thank me later. You really can't go with their menu. I've also tried the sopa de consomé (chicken and rice broth soup with onions, cilantro and jalapeños on the side with a mini quesadilla made with fresh cheese) I give it two thumbs up but I wish it was just a little warmer. 

I usually sit in the bar and the staff is attentive it only seating 10 and all but I usually play and always leave winning. Can't beat that.

Leticia's! Where have you been all my life? I have searched endlessly for a great Mexican restaurant in Las Vegas. I was losing hope until Leticia's came along. This Mexican Cocina has got it going on! I love the vibe and decor of the restaurant. My first visit was on a Friday night and boy was it packed to the brim in there! The wait was about 40 minutes. If you come during prime time, be prepared to wait a while.

Complimentary chips and salsa are pretty good. I really like the chips. They're warm and super fresh. Vegetarians be warned! The bean dip has chorizo in it. My husband can't get enough of that bean dip. The chorizo gives it an unexpected sweet taste. 

The menu is hefty and prices are a little higher than you're average Mexican restaurant. I was ecstatic to learn that Leticia's had potato and cheese flautas ($13.98). Whhaaa! I'm all about that vegetarian flauta life! The entree comes with 3 flautas and a side of rice and beans. The flautas are topped with guacamole, pico, and authentic Mexican queso (the tasty white crumbly cheese). This entree is way too much food for me, but I do my best to eat all I can, savoring every bite!

The Mexican rice here is where it's at it. I am particularly picky when it comes to Mexican rice. The Mexican rice at Leticia's, however, reminds me of the rice my mom and grandma make. I get all nostalgic eating that stuff! 

Service could be better, but it's sufficient.  

In a nutshell:
Food: 5
Ambiance: 4
Service: 3-4

Of course I'll be back! This is the only legit Mexican restaurant I've come across in Vegas.

YELP 100 CHALLENGE 2015: #12

Apparently, after three consecutive days of being on hold for no less than eight minutes before frustratingly hanging up, ( and thinking " OTRA  VEZ! No mames!!!) while only trying to order chicken posole to go, I have decided that this restaurant REALLY does not want my business or money. Wish granted.
Just had our 5/10 year anniversary and shared the carne asada for 2, and it was the expected level of awesomeness we have come to love from these guys. This place never disappoints
Food was sooo delicious service from Crystal was great. We will definitely come back.  Salud!.

My family used to love Leticia's. It was our go to Mexican spot and the food and service were always on point. Sadly, I must downgrade my past review. Over the years the prices have slowly gone up and I get that. I don't expect a restaurant to keep the same prices forever. I am a vegan and my husband is a vegetarian and we have limited menu choices at any restaurant. I have always loved their vegetable fajitas. On our last visit the price of veggie fajitas was $19. $19 for a hot plate of sizzling veggies, rice and beans??? I realize you get the fajita fixings and guacamole on the side but $19 is just too high for something I can make at home for a few bucks. Yes, I can make fajitas just as good at home with a flavor that's not just primarily salt. So, goodbye Leticia's...even though it is about 2 blocks from our house.

Had to try it after seeing the taco challenge on the cooking channel.  The hostess was a little confused right at 11 when they opened and we were a little worried but our fears quickly subsided when our waitress and bus boy took excellent care of us.  We loved the chips and the three dips and both got super fresh salads with the taco lunch special.  My husband had the ground beef taco and I had the carnitas and it was filled with lots of delicious meat and we loved the beans and rice too.  We asked for some hotter sauce and it was hot but tasty.  We also had some delicious margaritas.  We live in CA but will definitely make the trip to Leticia's the next time we are in town.

Fredy (Saul) and Tony were really good waiters. They gave us free sopapillas for my friends birthday! And they gave her the option of wearing the charro hat, which of course she did! Awesome food too!

I'm a vegas native and I have had mexican food all over this city my entire life, and I must say that Leticia's food is by far some of the best I have ever had!  We ordered their signature tacos, some tostadas and the fajitas!  All flavorful and amazing!  The carnitas taco was amazing, seasoning just perfect!  Their ground beef tostada was to die for!  Their ground beef has to be the best in Las Vegas!  I can't wait to come back to try a beef burrito!  The fajitas were piping hot and everything was succulent and juicy!  All white meat chicken!  We are waiting on sopapilla's and im more than positive I'll be mind blown by these as well!  The service was amazing, our waiter gave us the most amazing recommendations and I am so excited that I finally got to try this place!

Just saw the report on channel 13 about them receiving a "C" health grade from multiple food handling violations. 

We went there a few months ago when we first moved into the area. There were multiple great reviews so we were looking forward to trying it out. 

The vibe we got coming in set the tone. We did not feel welcome. Our service felt like they thought we were a waste of time, certainly not as a guest. 

We asked for one slight change to a menu item and that was flatly refused. 

Asked for some more chips and they took forever to do that, and tossed at us. 

Finally got our food, and it was pretty tasteless. 

The TV report saying they hid the "C" rating card, pretty much reflects my experience with them. 

The food and service were enough for us never trying it again. The volume of health violations are the capper.

All I can say is fuck Justin. Worst service ever. The food was cold and bland. Homeboy decided to drop my to-go box on the floor, throw out one piece of food that fell, put the rest back in and informed me that the "other part is fine", after I watched it hit the floor...  He was abrasive and sketchy, and the whole experience was incredibly disappointing.

great service and amazing food!!

I wish we had more locally owned places like this!

We came here on a friday night and the place was super packed.. We had to wait about 25 minutes to get our table. The service was awesome, everyone here was very nice and very attentive. The food was pretty good but nothing special.. The decor and the environment are pretty nice, the best thing is that they are open until 2am! I would probably come back and give it another chance.
This place is great. The food is amazing. The atmosphere is is really nice. The weather is perfect to sit on the patio.

Taking toddlers out to eat is a training exercise. Seriously. We are so thankful for the restaurants that are understanding of this. Leticia's is one of those places. We go there regularly for this reason. They are patient, tolerant, welcoming and gracious. Juan is regularly our server, and a true gentleman. And the food is amazing, too! Highly recommend for families.
Always worth the wait! So happy we stumbled upon this place after a late night trip to Lowe's!

Heard great things on this spot so I had to try it out. I'm new to the area so I was quite surprised that I could walk here from my home. The first time I went, the food was remarkable. The second time, not so much. Guess it depends on the cook! I'll give it another try just to see if the second time was a fluke
This place has delicious Mexican food. Love there chips and salsas and beans and rice. The restaurant is Nicely decorated and the service was amazing. Highly recommend coming here.
Just happen to be on this side of town and decided to try it. Great atmosphere!  We had the carne asada for one and the fish tacos!  Good size portions and food came out quick.

Love this place. The waitress was very helpful in answering my questions about the best plates. There is a Dayroom, but I like the area closer to the bar. It has a better feel, and you're not so close to the tables next to you.

Loved this place! Food, ambiance, and service.  I'm originally from orange county in Cali. And had been looking for a good Mexican place and thanx to yelp... atlast, a delicious and pleasant place to eat at.  If you love spicy food... I highly recommend the " habanero salsa!!!"

I just moved to Las Vegas 3 weeks ago, and have been in dire need of a good Mexican food fix.   Leticia's certainly fit the bill for it!

I had the chile Rellano stuffed with Beef.  It was quite tasty and much what I expect from a good rellano.   The salsas that were brought out with the chips were also quite tasty and the fresh chips were muy bueno!!!  

My server Dulce was very pleasant and friendly.   It was quite busy when I got there, but I was seated within 10 minutes.  The staff was all very friendly and pleasant.  I will definitely be trying this place again.

We happen to be in this part of town and decided to try Leticia's.  We almost didn't go in because parking looked ridiculous, but then we discovered a large parking lot in the back.   We were seated promptly and our waiter was very attentive.  We told him that we'd never eaten there before and he made some recommendations to us.  This was not your average Mexican place, and we had a hard time choosing from the menu.  I went with the 2 taco plate.....one with chicken tinga and one with pork carnitas.  Both were excellent and unlike anything I've ever had before.  The cilantro rice was delicious, also!  Hubby had a build-it-yourself burrito and he really enjoyed it.  We will definitly go back.

My husband saw this restaurant on the cooking channel and wanted to try it out! We loved the atmosphere and the staff was great! Everyone was friendly! We went on Valentine's night so it was super packed! Worth the wait! 
I am very picky when eating "Albondiga" soup and these were so delicious! My husband had the carne asada plate and he couldn't finish it! Which is a first, since he can eat! The portion was definitely not small! 
I tried a Strawberry Jalapeño Margarita and now I am hooked! 
We are definitely coming back here when we go back to visit Vegas!
Absolutely amazing!! My faves are the quest fundito  and the potato and cheese taquitos. Absolutely love love love the salsa.

My mom was in town for a weeklong visit and we wound up making two trips to Leticia's! The first time we sat at a booth by the bar and a college football game was on so it was a little loud but we could easily carry on a conversation. Our waiter was extremely helpful in answering questions, and we were promptly served our beer, waters and chips with salsa trio.

You can choose from family style or individual selections and we each chose seperately. My mom got Guisados de Casa -chile verde which was really good. The pork was super tender without being mushy or fatty and was seasoned well. I got chicken fajitas which were excellent....two people could easily share this. My husband got spicy chicken quesatacos...they were okay but the poblano casserole served alongside was awwwesome. 

Our second trip was just as successful. We went on a weeknight and it was much quieter. Our waitress was helpful, although not quite as prompt. Very friendly however! My mom went with spinach and mushroom enchiladas which she liked but I probably wouldn't order...I felt like they needed something to brighten them up and cut the heaviness of the creamy sauce. My husband and I each ordered grilled fish tacos with soft flour tortillas. I have had fish tacos from Ensenada to Costa Maya to Belize and I can say 100% that these were the best I've ever had, and it's hard to top eating them while sitting on a white sand beach with turquoise water staring at you. 

The fish was perfectly seasoned and light, super fresh tasting with a perfect fish to sauce ratio. The veggies were also perfectly proportioned and every bite was just as perfect as the first.  We mentioned to the server how much we enjoyed them and she told us on Monday nights their street-sized tacos are all available for 1.25 each! 

It's five minutes from our house...super close proximity to pick up after-dinner cupcakes from retro bakery (prior to dinner, retro closes at 7 I think) and both our visits yielded both stellar food and service. This will be a regular stop for us.

Waited 25 minutes before 2 seats opened at the bar, we were quoted 15 minutes for a table.  We waited for a long time before we got our food.  About 45+ minutes.  The food was tasty but my wife's was too spicy for her.  Granted she does not do spicy well, but she couldn't eat it.  The bartender didn't even ask us how we were doing or how the food was, but did appologize for the wait.  The drinks were expensive as was the cost for the food.  $85 for 2 people at a mexican restaurant is pretty pricey.

I am obsessed with this place! It's so cute, inside and out, big portions, and delicious food that sticks to being authentic!

I have gotten a sample platter to share with another and it was seriously so filling and yummy. I recommend it to try many options on their menu. And it's hard to fill me up as my appetite is ginormous lol. I also recommend the chicken enchiladas. Their mole sauce tastes pretty authentic and not generic or bad quality like most restaurants.

It is a bit pricey so it isn't your cheap Mexican eats. It's actually perfect for a nice occasion maybe like a date or taking friends or relatives from out of town...which is what I did. And my relatives loved it too!

The servers are also just amazing. So attentive and sweet. Please tip them well. 

They also have the cutest bar and fun, Latin music playing. It made us want to get up and dance, lol. The only thing is that the music is a BIT loud so if they turned it down a notch or two, it would be perfect. 

This is a great place for a nice, Mexican dinner. I highly recommend it!

Tried this place after the owners came to the YMCA community fair with free watermelon drink and chips and salsa samples. I will give any business who takes the time to support our community a spin. 

We went as a family and found the food of average quality for the price. The wait staff was attentive but the kitchen was slow. Then the karaoke started up and we just wanted to eat as quick as possible and leave. On a summer night starting the amateur songbirds at 8 sharp when families are still dining together felt chaotic. 

This place is close to our house so we will give it another spin when it is not karaoke night. Perhaps on a a Tuesday when I can't help but smell the fajitas they make on the patio when I drive by.
The portions are big and good. One of the best Mexican restaurants in town. Whatever you order in the menu is goin to be good. The prices are good too

I had been wanting to try Leticia's since I moved here in March. I was wishing I could give them 4 or 5 stars, but I wasn't impressed with the food at all. I ordered the fish tacos, while my hubby got the shrimp cocktail to start with the Chile rellenos. The shrimp tasted a little too fishy and not very fresh. The rellenos were good and seasoned well. My tacos were ok, just ok. I did like the variety of salsas and tasted great. I do have to say the customer service was excellent.

My wife and I finally tried Leticia's for lunch at the recommendation of our friends.  First I must start by saying that my wife makes the best authentic Mexican food around and we tavel to Mexico a lot as well so we are quite picky in this area.  After all the dissappointing experiences and attempts at finding good Mexican food in Vegas we had all but given up...until now!  Leticia's was a pleasant surprise with great food and awesome lunch prices.  It took a little bit to get noticed and seated, but after that the service was great.  There were a lot of items on the restaurant that you just don't see at other Mexican restaurants, and my wife commented about seeing dishes that her mom used to make...and her mom is where she got her skills from so great sign!  The chips and salsa were great, and lots of roasted options and good selection of heat.  My wife had Sopes and I had Carne Asada and Carnitas combo and both were great.  It is a great place for a lunch date or family and friends...we will definitely be back when we don't feel like cooking at home!

Food is awesome! Customer service is not unfortunately. We were told a 15 minute wait and were seated 45 mins later. Our waitress rushed us through the process and was very pushy and loud. Luckily the food saved the night! We will definitely be going back, but will be requesting a different waitress and will try to go earlier when it isn't as busy to get seated. Definitely a gem in Centennial Hills!

I was so disappointed with this visit. We never received share plates with our appetizers we had to use napkins. Once our entrees arrived the food looked tired and wilted like it had all been pre made and just sitting in the back. Rice was drastically over cooked. 

The server not once cleared our dirty plates from our table. I hate writing a 2 star review because I love to support neighborhood establishments but Leticia's has gone down hill and fast. Hopefully they can get back on track soon.

Very popular but very unpredictable and uneven.  The bar is always great and a margarita and complimentary chips with salsa and yummy bean dip can fill you up if you have to wait for a table which has always been the case for us.  Only two stars because the last time we went the food was not good, overly spiced, the meal was not served hot and the waiter could not be found after he took our order.  This was in the middle of the week too.  The prices are high and the servings are very large.  I think we will visit the bar and skip the food from now on.

This is my favorite mexican food restaurant in Vegas! The chips, salsa and dips they give you complimentary never disappoint! I always get enchiladas or build your own burrito. The portions are huge so it's usually 2 or 3 meals for me. Their bloody mary's are delicious too.

Have given it a few chances - not impressed.  Family suggested dinner.  Willing to try it again.  Around about 7:55 on a Friday evening.  Lots of empty tables but were told it would be a 45-minute wait because they were waiting for servers to arrive.  Seems that we could have been seated and ordered drinks while waiting.  Probably will not be back.
Service is always great. Salsa is delicious. None of the other food is worth ordering. There have been fruit flies in my Margarita.

Great Mexican food and much better than Lindo. It was packed but we still got seated in a reasonable time frame. Service was on point and quick. Our food was delicious, reasonably priced, and the portions were generous. This was our first time here and we will definitely be back!
This place always delivers!! The food was excellent as was the service! Excellent food at a reasonable price.

Love this restaurant. Excellent service always. The only reason I'm not giving 5 stars is because they increased some prices- $19 fajitas? They're super delicious and have a unique flavor but that's too expensive for some meat and veggies!

If I could do a 1/2 star I would. I've eaten here before awhile ago and enjoyed it. I was really looking forward to it so I brought my family. We sat here for over 30 minutes with no acknowledgement from any wait staff. Finally left since it didn't appear anyone really cared. Very disappointed.

ROACHES!!!???!!!! 

We always loved this restaurant (despite the usually slow service) but May 1st 2013 will have been our last time ever eating here. 

I am a couple months pregnant, my 6 year old son and my husband were given our entrees and as I leaned over for my second bite of fajitas I see a roach hanging out on  the table between my dinner plate and my fajita platter! 

My husband scooped it up with a napkin. We all just sort of froze out of disbelief! When the waiter stopped by a few moments later, my son announced there had been a roach on our table. My husband discreetly handed him (Mario) the napkin. He didnt seem too frazzled by this. 

Mario informed us that the owner have been spending a lot of money trying to fix their bug problem! Umm??? Hello??? They know they have a serious problem and they are still serving costumers??? 

I left the table and went to the car. When my husband showed up I asked him what they did or said about this. He said they gave us 3 dollars off our meal! Wow, thanks! 

There is a call being put into the health dept. on this issue. ROACHES and food dont mix!!!!

Recommended by a friend, so we yelped it. Good reviews. Food was very good, the chips and 3 different salsa they give is also delish. But we got full on those waiting on or meal to come out. Or waiter was great, very helpful with the menu and explaining what was what and recommended some good dishes. A little pricy but worth it. We'll be back.

My girlfriend, friend and his wife came here for dinner on Sunday night and Rogelio was our server. The service was great! Rogelio was quick with drinks, and very personable! The food came out in a reasonable amount of time, and it was delicious. We got the build your own burrito, taco salad and carnitas. I would highly recommend Leticia's, and would definitely come back to see Rogelio again! :)

Really nice location. There's a nice atmosphere and friendly staff. It's pretty busy here right now. We ordered the nachos and choose the ground beef. It was really good. I think the carne asada or grilled chicken would be better. Ordered the carne asada tacos and the fish tacos. Both were really good. The fish tacos are some of the best I've had. I got them battered instead of grilled fish.

Very good food! I had the shrimp fajitas and the guacamole with crap as an appetizer, definitely recommend both! Our drinks and appetizer was brought out fast but the food took a little longer to come out but was worth the wait. The atmosphere was good and the place is well decorated with a choice to sit in or outside. Our waitress was very nice and the prices were very affordable. The best Mexican food we've had here in Vegas yet!

1 star = Terrible. Multiple things went wrong. Never going back.
2 star = Not good. I will not go back, but it wasnt absolutely awful.
3 star = Good, not great. I wouldnt go out of my way, but I *would* go back.
4 star = Excellent food. I really liked it. I could be a regular here.
5 star = Phenomenal food. Something truly special here.

This is our new fave Mexican place in LV. We still heart Casa Don Juan, but it's way on the other side of town.

The decor is nice, but maybe just a tad dark on the bar side. They brought out chips, salsa and bean dip, all of which were delicious. Best chips and salsa BY FAR that we have had in LV. The food was really really good. My wife had crispy tacos -- she loved the carne asada but didnt care for the chicken. The 13 year old had the ground beef taco and liked it. I had the Quesa Shrimp Tacos, the house specialty, and they were very good (the corn tortillas were ok, not great). The shrimp was SCRUMPTIOUS! Overall, the food was very good. Warning: the portion sizes are HUGE.

I can see what other people are saying about the service. Our server was somewhat indifferent. It took quite a while to get our food. But it didnt ruin our meal, and I wouldnt let it stop you from trying the place.

It was a bit pricey -- $50 for 2 sodas, a 2 taco plate, a 1 taco plate, and the special tacos.

Leticias is a quaint place with excellent service. I took advantage of the $15 for $30 deal on yelp + a free margarita. They bring out heaping amount of fresh tortilla chips with 3 dips that are delicious in their own way. I ordered chicken tortilla soup and enchiladas with spicy sauce rice and beans. My server was attentive and very polite!

Solid mex food and solid drinks, especially if you live in the Northwest Valley.  This is the upscale mexican you are looking for , some would give it 5 stars, but I wouldnt as while its authentic, something is missing, maybe it just the fact they have to produce more, it misses some of that motherly love from a tiajuana street house or a few leaves of cilantro, or maybe its missing a lime.  NOt sure, but its really really good, I would rate the food 5 stars, value 4 stars, location 1 star, unless you live up here in Canada Vegas, and 4 star service, 4 star atmosphere, so 4 stars...If I could give it a half star I would....give it a try...undalay undalay yee ba esa...esa..........OH, by the way, the drinks are 5 star!

After trying so many mexican restaurants we finally found the best, Amazing service!! My new favorite mexican restaurant, and the service is the best! 
Such a great service from our server Ricardo!!

This place has some yummy chile colorado. I had their Tamarindo margarita and it was amazing. Our server was very nice too (can't remember his name...maybe it was the margarita ;)). I will continue to go to this restaurant as it's nearby and has a good selection. Try it out as I'm sure you'll love it too.

place was a bit dirty in my opinion
fruit fly in my water and received a dirty dish to use for our appetizers.
probably wont be back, rather drive to Lindo Michoacan which is maybe 5 minutes away
best thing about this place was the food runner, he helped us more than our actual server.

Love this spot. This is the best mexi in vegas for me. The line out the door is proof. I pass the resteraunt on my way home in the evenings and there are always folks waiting out side. I try to go during off peak hours. The service is always good and I have never had a bad trip.

Came here for happy hour with a friend. We had a good experience! I would come back again.

Pros:
-happy hour prices are very reasonable!
-house margaritas are good (not super boozy, but also not too sweet)
-complimentary chips/salsa are yum
-lots of vegetarian options
-$2.50 happy hour options (party of 2 and we ordered 4 and were full!)

Cons:
-service was a little bit too slow (we were left alone for long periods of time and we ran out of water multiple times)
-limited parking close to the entrance (but not terrible)

Finding great Mexican food is Vegas is harder than one would think. Leticia's is our "go-to", primarily because of the fantastic drinks, fun atmosphere, clean restaurant, and friendly service. We've been here enough to know what we like to order, but I'm docking them a couple stars because we've had a few misses on our entrees over the years. The carnitas, carne asada, and generally anything on the family style menu have been delicious. Some of their other dishes, (such as the pork guisados) have been lacking in flavor, or overly greasy.  So, give Leticia's a shot, but ask your waiter for his or her recommendation.

This place must of been having an off night when I came because it seems to be pretty popular. When my girlfriend and I arrived there was quite a wait . Thing is we had terrible service. They were having staffing issues so our waitress who typically bartender was having a hard time keeping up. The chips and salsa were just ok and it took a long time for her to even take our drink order. Once we finally placed our order I made it clear I do not want beans . Sadly they showed up right on my plate with my chile releno .. Overall it was just not as good as I heard. My friends quesadilla had issues too but I didn't try it . We did have her apologies and I understand sometimes these things happen. Hopefully if I get the chance to try it out again they will wow me but for now it's just meh

I haven't even eaten here yet & at this point, not sure if I want to. I called to make reservations for 7. They don't take reservations (pet peeve #1). A friend called closer to our scheduled dinner time to find out if there was call ahead seating. The snippy person on the other line said "we don't take reservations or call ahead seating. The current wait time is 25-30min & it will get longer the longer you wait and btw we won't seat your party until everyone is here." Well Leticia's you might be loosing out on business from 7 paying customers.

Had a great meal at Leticia's!  The server was excellent and had no problem recommending his favorite dishes.   I'm a fajita fan and usually get them at every Mexican restaurant on my first visit.  Leticia's did not dissapoint.  My wife got a flauta platter that was ok, not the best she's had, but still very good.   Overall, a good experience, highly recommend.

We travel a ridiculous distance to get to Leticia's (according to our friends)...  But we used to live a couple of miles away in Centennial Hills, and now that we have moved to Henderson, our "couple of minutes" drive changed to a "little over a half hour" drive.  But, um, we still do it...  Here's a quick list of why:
1) Best Margarita in the valley.  Well, if you like them... I know, every place makes them differently, but here they use multiple fresh squeezed lime slices and that works with the pattern of fresh food here, and it's really tasty.
2) Best interesting drink - the Pomegranite Margatini is totally unique and I can't even list all of the ingredients here...  But it's one of my wife's favorite drinks of all time!
3) Ignacia - oh, yeah, the Margatini is generally only a good drink if she's the one who makes it.  Everything she makes is awesome, even if she's taking care of the bar and the entire dining room at the same time...
4) Ignacia again - sorry to be redundant, but beyond drinks, she knows the food and what mama's making, and knows what is good, and very quickly learns what you like!  Which is invaluable... Even if you don't know what to order, just let her do it.
5) To be fair, even if Ignacia is not working, the food is all fantastic and the drinks are awesome.  I just wish they'd open a place in Henderson!
My favorite Mexican restaurant in town. They have the best sangria with apples in town.

Leticia, where have you been all my life? So glad I finally stopped in to check it out. All thanks to my sweetie for his recommendation. He knows the way to my heart...Mexican food! ;) 
The food is amazing, flavorful and very authentic. Complimentary chips & salsa to start. A few minutes to look over the menu. We decided on the carne asada plate with cilantro rice & beans. He ordered the BYOB (build your own burrito) chimichanga style. Everything was delicious and the staff are super friendly and attentive. I'm pretty sure this is my favorite Mexican restaurant now. 

Don't forget to use the Yelp Deal: $15 for $30

Leticias has become my favorite Mexican restaurant. Everything I've had has been excellent. The burritos are the best anywhere, and are huge. And I highly recommend trying the QuesoTaco. 

The staff is very friendly and are very helpful when you have questions. My family will definitely make this place a regular visit!

I really enjoyed the food here. I made a too go order for tamales (beef, pork and chicken) and some refried beans and rice on the side. They all tasted flavorful and home made :-) the place was packed but my order was ready and waiting for me at the bar. I'll be back for sure :-)

Come here quite often, in my opinion this is probably one of the better Mexican restaurants in town. Prices are a bit high but you get what you pay for. I love the complimentary green salsa as well as the red salsa. Only complaint from me is service. Bartenders are awesome but wait staff, is not always the best. I work as a server as well & I just believe you should always make your guests feel welcomed rather than a nuisance. Our server Dolce (i believe was her name, didn't get a receipt) was extremely rude. My friends and I sat without water for about 20 minutes. we consistently tried to get our servers attention & she just kept walking away from our table as we were trying to order a drink. & then when I finally got frustrated and went to the bar to order my Bloody Mary, she asked me why I didn't order the drink through her! & when I responded saying that I had tried to, several times, she told me I didn't. Whatever, I just kept to myself but when it came to paying we had asked for separate checks & she brought one check & then disappeared for another 15 minutes & then split the checks with the wrong items on each bill. TWICE. I can understand that being confusing had there of been 10 of us or something but there were only 3. It's not that hard. Needless to say, my friends and I got so frustrated that we just paid the bill and then figured out the proper amounts later on. Overall experience... Disappointing, but I will be back nonetheless because the food is good.

My husband and I ate there with friends Sunday. Our friends believe this is the best ever.  I disagree.  The Worst ever. I had fajitas and they were Greasy and not Fresh. This food was worst ever I see why they were closed down a few weeks ago with a C rating. Their food sucks. I didn't say anything didn't want to embarrass our friends. My husband says we should go again and see if this was an off night. I think I would rather go to del taco or taco bell
The service was great and the food was delicious. Nothing to complain about. Will def go back again soon

Right of the bat, the food at Leticia's is the best Mexican food I have ever had in Las Vegas and I'm a Vegas native. I consider Leticia's part of my weekly nutrition plan and actually buget monthly to eat there.  The staff is always awesome and helpful. Sometimes they get very busy and the food many take a few extra minutes to come out, but I understand that happens sometimes and it's worth the wait. The prices are fair and I'm always more than satisfied when I leave there. Management is always friendly and will go out of their way to say hello and make sure all is going well when dining at Leticia's. I hate when I see negative comments about Leticia's on Yelp. People just like to complain about anything. Stay home and eat Taco Bell if your an unhappy hater! Thanks Leticia's for the great food and service every time.

Food was very tasty. There's always a bunch of people there so there was a bit of a wait. When we got to our table we didn't have silver ware or napkins till after boh our drink and food orders were put in. We didn't get our chips till then either. It was also slightly hard to communicate to the servers and others at the table because the music was very loud. A member of m group order the soup and he said it came out room temperature. He asked for it to be warned up which I'm sure just involved a microwave. I order the enchilada teqitos  which were very tasty. The child in our group gobbled up his chicken and was super satisfied with his dinner. Still love this place.

I'm lovin this place. came here as a recommendation from a close friend and man I was happy I went. First time was with family and the 2nd time for happy hour appetizers. The service staff has always been so sweet and kind. Very attentive and are right on time to fill up our drinks. Never an attitude about getting more chips and three dips, as well. Unlike other places. Food is reasonably priced and AWESOME. I'm also happy with the atmosphere, lightly dimmed and not too loud. We are able to talk at our table to each other and not have to yell. ;) 
I will continue to go back and look forward to the great food and service!!

It's so sad cause this place is in such a beautiful ambiance ,  the atmosphere is wonderful... But the food is horrible...  But u can get a pitcher of margaritas for a good price!  So don't go there if you are looking for good food...
I expected more... the food wasn't great. It didn't taste like authentic mexican food. The service was great and the place is nice.

Leticia's is my longstanding go-to Mexican restaurant in Northwest Las Vegas.  The location is a bit obscure, but worth looking for.   The margaritas are very tasty, the tamales are delicious and the mole enchiladas are wonderful.

I've been here a few times and to me the food isn't bad but not the best.  I do have a problem with the frozen margaritas.  On two occasions, the same thing: the margarita is liquid and not frozen, along with being not very cold.  I felt it sat in a blender all day and the ice melted and it was served.  I may go back, but I won't order a margarita.

Great service, So  Friendly! Everyone was able to answer questions we had about the food, how it was made and what came with it or on it. Every detail to our request was met. The atmosphere was casual, fun and ethnic. Although we sat inside, The patio looked very  inviting with it strung lights and cozy tables.  And the food....WOW!! So Authentic, Fresh and tasty. This place is right in my neighborhood and I will definately recommend and return with friends.
Food was good, but thought it was a little pricey for the meals as delivered.  We were pretty astounded when we got our bill and were charged $1.50 x 3 for "extra" Pica de Gallo.

This place is a ZERO! I took my husband there for his birthday dinner after a few good reviews. Well, this place was just awful! We waited two hours for a table they do not take reservations. Went to the bar to wait and waited 20 minutes for someone to notice and ask us if we wanted anything** another 25 minutes to receive our drinks a bottle beer and a house Margarita with no straw!
